author: akashnayyar
text:
Best movie in recent years.
Although the original is incomparable, this is a good movie but more CGI then original and those lights in helmet, Only gen-x will be able to appreciate, The storyline could've been better if relationships were carried forward from the original. Top Gun anthem and those aviators on pilots are awesome. Tom Cruise was damn good at 25 and he is damn good at 60. Best movie of recent years. The screenplay always sticks to the storyline. Very good footage of naval aircraft.

author: zvywdzy
text:
Surprised and Rewarded for going to see it.
Quickly immersed, tense throughout and highly emotional. Hit every thing I had wished for.

There were moments that no popcorn could be heard chewing throughout the theatre.

author: tdubs-69240
text:
Did not disappoint! Great sequel!
Came in with low expectations but left feeling nostalgic and satisfied. Great flick! The flying scenes are absolutely incredible! I haven't been in a theater to see a movie since early 2020 because of Covid and there really wasn't anything that pulled me to a theater. This movie did and was well worth it! Go see this movie people!

author: bluexjay
text:
Fun, Hopeful and Uplifting
Great film, left the theater in high spirits. Tom Cruise proves he is a true star, accompanied by a fantastic cast of young pilots. The music and visuals were amazing. Highly recommend. Simple story, but a real gem! We need films like this, especially in these dark times.

author: kmchugh-88331
text:
Don't be fooled by the high rating.
It was ok, but not a great movie. Predictable. Good flying scenes though. After hearing so much positive was really looking for a Forrest Gump, Shawshank. Not even close.

author: shrikantpande2000-154-301655
text:
Goosebumps all over ...
*Top Gun Maverick*

*Top Gun Maverick*, an eight years long project in film making was completed in early 2020 and was to be released in July 2020 but due to Covid Pandemic the release dates changed 5 times. And finally the film hit the theaters on 27th June 2022. It was almost 35 years after the first film Top Gun released in 1986 which was my all time fav film and must have seen over a dozen times. The film had great actors' ensemble Tom Cruise, Kelly McGillis, Val Kilmer, Tom Skeritt, Tim Robbins and a special apperance of Meg Ryan. All wonderful starcast. To add a more spice to the fast paced movie, it had a wonderful soundtrack and music composed by Harold Faltermayer and songs by famous singers and rock bands like Kenny Loggins, Teena Marie, Cheap Trick, Mi

author: shrikantpande2000-154-301655
text:
termayer and songs by famous singers and rock bands like Kenny Loggins, Teena Marie, Cheap Trick, Miami Sound Machine, Berlin (You take my breath away) and of course the great Top Gun Anthem composed by Harold Faltermayer.

With all this aspects, yesterday we went to see Top Gun Maverick, with so many questions in mind. Does the new film have all same starcast ? Except Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer. Was there any replacement of stars ? What about the soundtrack and music of the film ? How about the dog fight scenes in the films ? The excitement of watching the film was at its peak. Goosebumps all over during watching film. The film also gave a nostalgic feeling in the the opening credits and opening scene with same Top Gun anthem played as in the first film, Meg Ryan appears for some time in

author: shrikantpande2000-154-301655
text: pening scene with same Top Gun anthem played as in the first film, Meg Ryan appears for some time in a flashback scene. There is a good and refreshing entry of Jennifer Connely and Miles Teller as the "Rooster". Tom Cruise the "Maverick" is fantastic as ever. Val Kilmer as the "Ice" gave brilliant and a small appearance. The dialogs between Maverick and Ice makes you emotional. There are fast paced and beautifully shot flight scenes of F-18 jet planes, partcularly the jets flying in the canyons and the dog fights and the ariel combats. The soundtrack of film is spendid and best part is that the original Top Gun Anthem is retained in the film. Hans Zimmer joins with Harold Faltermayer to compose the music, songs and the background scores of the film. All and all a wonderful experience to wa

author: shrikantpande2000-154-301655
text: ose the music, songs and the background scores of the film. All and all a wonderful experience to watch the film in the theater. For all those Top Gun fans out there, will find 3 types of Goosebumps, pre-movie, during the film and post-movie. A must watch film for all !!!!

author: claudejunge
text:
A mix
It felt slightly disjointed.

The movie seems similar to a Best Of album.

They took all the best scenes they had and cramed them in that package.

They took the best out of the first Top Gun and included it.

The movie is often unrealistic. The movie is a giant Tom Cruise advertising. He had to be In in the end, although he knew better. The MI flair is too much.

The caracters are too glam to be true, too flattering.

But I do like many pieces, I do like the music at the beginning, I do like Tom's coolness, I liked many of the stunts.

To me the pieces don't add up nicely, but the movie is rather good if you like Tom and Top Gun.

author: nouralialhalabi
text:
The best movie I've seen in 2022 so far
I was thrilled of that movie!!! The best movie I've seen in 2022 so far! I don't know where to start. The acting ? The filming? The story was so good to attract me as an audience to stay interested and excited till the last bit of the movie, and i loved how the ending didn't finish like any other typical movie of tom cruise dying in return for the death or roster father , or roster died in return to save maverick, or the both died , the movie made me very interested and excited to know how will it end, it made me feel nervous, i felt like i was in it with them haha , i give the movie 10/10 , and I didn't check the timing for the first time while watching a movie hahaha.

author: kevingn
text:
Awesome!
Wow, what a great movie. It is excellent to go to the theatre and see a normal movie, one that does not involve superheroes, fantasy, or social justice. The film is long, at two hours and eleven minutes, but it goes by very quickly. This is a must see in theatres!

author: stang_man
text:
Outstanding.
Like many of the other reviewers here, I was 19 when I saw Top Gun. I was in summer school in college, full of dreams and idealism. Seeing this now at 55 after being married with adult children and all the life experiences that has brought with it, all I can say is; thank you Tom Cruise, Jerry Bruckheimer, Val Kilmer, and basically everyone involved with the making of this film (and the original). The love, dedication and passion put into this movie is obvious throughout. You have restored my hope in Hollywood. I hope you are working to mentor a new generation of filmmakers, since they have some awfully large shoes to fill.

author: gtdmouse
text:
better than you would expect for this type of movie
Man, this movie had no business being as good as it was. In preparation for watching this, I went and watched the original, which I don't believe I had seen since around when it came out, and it didn't hold up very well. I probably wouldn't have gone to see this one in the theater if I hadn't heard it was getting such a good reception. Totally worth it. Sure, the plot and the characters are pretty predictable, and they certainly went in on the nostalgia (but not too much), but it's all done so well, you're totally taken along for the ride. The flight scenes were so well done. The humor was surprisingly good. There's more than a few moments where you'll likely get choked up. Overall, very well done.

author: aleksi-89236
text:
The best action movie ever made
I was kind of expecting the movie to be great but words can't describe the way this movie made me feel. Every flying scene was so intense and beautifully made that you were on the edge of your seat from start to finish. This is just what Cruise wanted us to see, a love letter to aviation.

Also if you are going to see only one movie this year, it is most certainly this one!

author: imdb-26714
text:
You will love it!
I was afraid of having to much expectations but this movie feels awesome. Yes there are similarities but overall it's just unreal footage from the cr√®me de la cr√®me of the movie industry. Actors Tom and Jennifer are just part of our life as we get old and it is so nice to see them creating such top level movies.

And the theater experience, as we see a lot on our home cinema you almost forget how sound has got a BIG influence on the movie (wow!).

Oooh this is just real good stuff!!!! I wanna be a fighter pilot... AGAIN! üôåüòÅ

author: poiema
text:
Best movie for the family in a very long time
Great cast, perfect to premiere Memorial Day Weekend where you left extremely glad and proud to be an American! One of the best sequels of all times and, quite honestly, better than the first. The movie score was very good, the cast was excellent and Tom Cruise never disappointed. The whole family can go to this one and not worry about having a 'woke' agenda shoved down your throat. It should get Oscar nod for best picture. Who knows, people might start watching the Academy Awards again.

author: kstreet-42852
text:
A Love Letter To Aviation
WOW. I had high expectations for this film to begin with, and it still managed to surpass them. I'm a part of the younger generation that was shaped by the original movie, in all of its cheesy-80's nostalgic glory.

Top Gun: Maverick is all of the nostalgic, none of the cheesy. I was in tears the moment it started. It would be a sore mistake to not see this one in theaters. Don't walk; don't run; FLY.

author: riejameskal
text:
This is probably one of the best cinematic films I've ever seen.
So far this film has done better than the original which doesn't usually happen when a sequel is produced. That says something.

I love how they took their time with writing the story, it was so well done and such an incredible plot. The film was delayed like 2 years if I recall, I remember watching the trailer years ago. But I can tell you that it was well worth the wait.

Everything about the flying, cast, cinematography and visuals were stunning and mind blowing. I don't think any film will be able to recreate such a masterpiece. The camera work was perfect and I had never felt so immersed in my life!

The screen time didn't feel short either and what I love is how the second half was un-predictable and not expected

author: riejameskal
text:
didn't feel short either and what I love is how the second half was un-predictable and not expected what so ever. My heart was racing and the thrill feeling was incredible. My friends Apple Watch was literally warning him to lower his heart rate!!!!

Overall, It's a masterpiece. A well made film that I would happily watch anytime. Yea Avengers Endgame is good but not compared to this cinematic experience. Top Gun: Maverick definitely deserves higher reviews.

author: vhrsxdr
text:
Unbelievable
I felt like more of a man after watching this movie. Absolutely unbelievable. First time in a long time a sequel has lived up to, if not exceeded, the legacy of a classic original.

author: gburnard
text:
Possibly the best movie I have ever watched!
I can see why Tom wanted to save this for the big screen. This deserves the full movie experience and reminds you what an epic blockbuster really is. Love the tie backs to the original Top Gun yet this movie stands alone as simply great movie.

author: michael-martin40
text:
One of the best sequels I've seen
This film had a lot to live up too and it delivered. Almost all sequels never live up to the original but this did and went even further. Will definetly been going to see it again whilst it's in the cinema.

author: bissetts-30541
text:
Masterpiece: A Modern Day Classic
This movie brings audience back to an era of true cinema. Not theme-park type films we've seen from Marvel that has corrupted the box office. Top Gun: Maverick gives the audience what they want and what they had no idea they wanted along with so much more. An absolute must watch!!

author: gsinghsingh
text:
Masterpiece
If you really want to enjoy this movie, watch in 4DX-2D. Plane scenes are really insane.

Loved the cast and story line.

Please go and enjoy this movie in theatre.

author: tom-hobson15
text:
All hail Tom Cruise!
I adore Top Gun, and have seen it over 100 times, can recite it word for word, and is the reason I'm a pilot. I've never been so excited for a movie. Not even for Endgame or the collosal disaster; Die Hard 5.

I saw this on the 21st May in Macau, 4 days before it's European realease.. ... Odd. Hence why it's the first review.

I was excited / nervous for it to do well, but I had faith in Tom Cruise's dedication to his craft, and perfectionism.

He delivered! And then some!

A perfect sequel.. the opening had me giddy with glee, giggling and cheering and fist pumping the air in the cinema.

The movie has everything. The flying is sooo amazing and real, with the actors really pulling those Gs in the aircaft. With Real character development for Maverick, some s

author: tom-hobson15
text:
actors really pulling those Gs in the aircaft. With Real character development for Maverick, some sad moments, and a beautiful inclusion of a not well Val Kilmer. A nice new personal journey for Maverick to navigate. It has So many links to the original, and the perfext balance is struck between nods and homage to the original film vs ripoff and copycat ala Hangover 2. It has everything.

If you know the first movie well you will have alot of moments of 'oh that's just like that bit' and 'ooh is he gonna say that, or do this' a lovely experience to live.

The finale had be squirming in my seat flying every twist and turn, clenched, excited, riveted and scared. It's almost like Top Gun meets Mission Impossible.. we also get the obligatory Tom Cruise running scene üòÖ.

It doesn't repea

author: tom-hobson15
text:
eets Mission Impossible.. we also get the obligatory Tom Cruise running scene üòÖ.

It doesn't repeat the story of the first one, but continues it into something else, that's entirely different yet very familiar. Maverick faces more challenges this time around on a personal level, and the love interest story is in keeping with a character his age who's lived his life. He is also more badass this time around.

With characters like Rooster (have a think about that one) and Hangman, a kinda Iceman, Maverick rolled into one.. you get taken on a new journey for the movie, for them, and for Maverick himself in last chance saloon.

It's obvious that it can't have the innocent 80s charm of the first one. That era is gone and making a retro movie would feel weird. But it's in its own era, it ow

author: tom-hobson15
text:
irst one. That era is gone and making a retro movie would feel weird. But it's in its own era, it owns and embraces that, and makes the most of it too, with Tom Cruise and his mega productions to great effect. No using the same shot repeatedly ala Top Gun. Theyve got a tonne of flying and it's all concurrent.

Eveything you want to happen happens. It's emotional, amazing, triumphant, sad, and fun (in no order!). A stunning movie, that could not have been better. Don't think this kind of movie can or will be done again. Stunning. Such and achievement.

I will go again to the movies with my kids.. and feel like I should go a third time, to make it my most watched movie in the cinema over Endgame. Sit back, strap in, get some tissues, and don't forget to breathe!

author: tom-hobson15
text: ndgame. Sit back, strap in, get some tissues, and don't forget to breathe!

author: FeastMode
text:
A throwback to 1980's movies
This is a slightly modernized version of the original. It has the same essence and feel, which is impressive after 36 years. It's enjoyable and mostly well-made with certain scenes living up to the term "blockbuster." It's definitely worth watching in IMAX, especially with the expanded aspect ratio.

The flight scenes are once again fantastic, with the only flaw being too many cuts instead of holding on a shot. The story is investing with some good heart. The musical score is awesome. Tom Cruise somehow continues to do his own stunts, which adds a realism that we don't see as often these days. He even has a running scene like in so many of his movies. But I can't blame him, he's really good at it.

On the other hand, I'm generally not a fan of 80's movies

author: FeastMode
text:
n't blame him, he's really good at it.

On the other hand, I'm generally not a fan of 80's movies so that aspect didn't do as much for me as it will for others. And some of the nostalgia stuff feels a bit forced. They still memorize and sing the same songs 36 years later?

In the end, I had a good time with this movie. Big fans of the original will love it, and casuals will be entertained. (1 viewing, early screening IMAX 5/24/2022)

author: Tweetienator
text:
Fine Flight
Top Gun: Maverick is a good sequel to the original, with some spectacular dogfights; a fine production and solid acting make the piece whole. I also dare to say, that most who like the first movie will like this one too. The greatest con: what Maverick mostly misses is an interesting story. The story is of very simplistic nature, a very basic one that we all - in whatever context set - watched a zillion times before. For sure Maverick is good pop-corn cinema with some fine moments, and tasty for the right audience, but not as good as many reviewers here on Imdb claim boldly. In my opinion for example, The Edge of Tomorrow is the far stronger movie - it got good acting, a fine production, lots of action and spectacular visuals too, but, last but not least, a well crafted and su

author: Tweetienator
text: oduction, lots of action and spectacular visuals too, but, last but not least, a well crafted and superior script (compared to Maverick). Exact rate: 7 + 1 for the spectacular visuals. A fine flight, but not an excellent one.

author: Samthesham67
text:
The best sequel ever!
Congratulations to Tom Cruise and his team on setting the bar for all sequels yet to come. This is the film that every sequel wants to be! It far exceeded my expectations and, 4 hours later, I'm still buzzing. I'm not going to go into specifics as this will spoil it for those yet to see it, but the nods to the original film were amazing, very poignant and sometimes emotional. I can't praise this film enough!

author: zollah99
text:
Best movie of all time?
I have watched probably over a thousand movies in my lifetime, and I honestly can't think of a better movie. It has it all and will invoke all the feelings in those few hours.

If you liked the original, then you will love this one. If you have not seen the first one, you will still love this one, and I guarantee that you'll drive home fast to watch the original on Netflix or HBO.

This is what movies should be about; take your parents, take your kids, take your friends, and enjoy an epic type of movie that we rarely see these days!

I am 100% going to rewatch it in theaters!

author: Sergiodave
text:
Way better than I could have ever hoped for
I saw this last night on IMAX, which for this movie is a must, the sound and picture quality is pretty essential. I thought the original was great fun, a little bit too homoerotic, but well made with great flying sequences. A movie I loved as a kid in the 80's but got less enthused as I aged. This movie beats the original hands down, and I would put it in my top 10 sequels. The flying sequences are the best anyone has ever seen on celluloid, the story is a clever one, which I won't spoil, but is full of little surprises. The cast are all great and the directing from Joseph Kosinski is amazing. I'll go to the cinema 40+ times this year and I strongly doubt I'll see a better blockbuster in 2022. Well done.

author: mladen982
text:
As good as it could get in present day
Original was US Navy draft add but blow up because of music and stile like a hallmark of the times. There was no point to sequel except usual motives ($) and as sequels go this is a very smart movie in regard to how it was constructed. They new exactly what people want and would like to see and gave them exactly that. But they also know not to overdue it with nostalgia. So, a good mixture and as title goes its a movie centered on Tom and he is again that character, so no passing the torch thank god. Most of other characters are ok but bland and forgettable.

Main dramatic conflict of the movie is lame but you have to have something. That is also a big problem for me, this movie is even less realistic and more silly then the first one. "The army" is

author: mladen982
text:
g problem for me, this movie is even less realistic and more silly then the first one. "The army" is not strict at all and is all "hugy" and "feely". It has no ideological preaching sub context almost a given for present day and that's a good thing. Its not even a draft add like the first one, there is not as much "America, yeah!" moments as you would expect.

Biggest disappointment in the movie for me are highly praised flight scenes. They are not that impressive with just identical closeups from front and lots of fast passed shaky cam. Arial shoots of original in my opinion are far more impressive and believable. End mission is also silly and unbelievable but that doesn't matter. The point of this movie and what audience wanted to see is Tom Cruise being Maverick again and kick ass and

author: mladen982
text: nt of this movie and what audience wanted to see is Tom Cruise being Maverick again and kick ass and in that regard it completely delivers.

author: BrnzReviews
text:
"A Need For Speed" Top Tier Sequel
This is it, the moment we've all been waiting for.. Top Gun: Maverick! Tom Cruise makes his long awaited return as Pete "Maverick" Mitchell, facing his reckless past as he takes on a new team of Top Gun trainees. I thought this was probably one of the best sequels we've had to a classic in years, these days it's all money motivated with no real emotion behind their craft but this is not the case for Top Gun: Maverick.

It was so great to see some familiar faces return like the incredible Val Kilmer reprising his role as Tom "Iceman" Kazansky, without him I don't know how I would of felt about this, although his screen time was not long, it sure was impactful and I thought it was beautiful they writ into the story his real life struggles.

This is no

author: BrnzReviews
text:
tful and I thought it was beautiful they writ into the story his real life struggles.

This is no ordinary journey, no ordinary flight. This film is the one I'm calling movie of the year to date, something really good has to come and take this spot, the fighter jet scenes were so intense and realistic (Tom Cruise actually got everything on point to the point of filming in real jets with real pilots) this man is something else.

Highly Recommend, don't pass up this opportunity of Top tier entertainment, be sure to catch the first Top Gun beforehand.

author: Kimal9000
text:
I have only given a 10 to two movies before...
...and none of those were action movies. But this is a ten, whichever way you look at it! This may be the only action movie I've seen that deserves that rating. With the possible exeption of David Camerons "Aliens".

Tom Cruise only get better and better! And his movies only get better and better! Where will this end? This movie improves upon the original in every department, and that's immensly impressive for a 60 year old competing with his twenty-something star-self!

Top Gun: Maverick is real movie-craft done the right way, not just pushing buttons on a computer. And yes: Humans can tell the difference. (I remember in the eighties when electronic drums came around, and every artist began using it on record! And after a while, they did

author: Kimal9000
text: electronic drums came around, and every artist began using it on record! And after a while, they didn't.,,, I suspect CGI effects are going the same path. Sometimes you have to use them; But when it is possible to do it the right way, call Tom Cruise ;) After watching this movie I got a feeling of gratitude and love for Tom Cruise; he must surely be the hardest working movie maker in the industry these days! He cares about every aspect of the craft, no compromise! The man's unstoppable! And thank God for that!

author: sfjeternal
text:
You can be my sequel anytime
Let's turn and burn! Not very often is an extremely high expectation met or exceeded but this particular sequel is part of the 'top 1 percent'. The action sequences, the camaraderie, the character arcs, the planes! All top marks. You can tell it was lovingly and painstakingly put together. Do yourself a favor and see it in IMAX. Glen Powell is a starrrrrrrr.

author: sofieberiksen
text:
A gem in cinematic history
The writing, the photography, the actors, the directing and the music are out of this world. A sequel which truly lives up to any expectations. This sequel is fire. I have no more words, just WOAW! 10/10 movie

Go watch it if you haven't yet and remember to enjoy.

author: amar_lfc
text:
This is why we go to the Movies
Top Gun MAVERICK was superb and it did everything it said on the tin and more. So if you watched the original then you would know it had all the hallmarks of the 1986 cult classic . Very similar story In fact but that's where similarities end. It's far better action and the dog fight traning sequences are spectacular, stunning , breathtaking etc etc , an absolute must go see movie if you like war movie navy action . To sum up, the story was nothing special, its pretty much a reboot of the original but surely that's not the reason your going to watch Top Gun for is it .

author: frantam-25634
text:
One of a kind
It is a rare occasion, if ever, that someone can say that a sequel might have been better than the original. Top Gun Maverick is a movie where I can say that. Top Gun came out when my mother was in high school, something her dad enjoyed, something I enjoy. We packed into the small hometown theater with the most amount of people I've seen in years, there were four generations in the theater that day, from young kids to great grandparents.

Top Gun Maverick was able to be so many different kinds of movies in one, and it excelled at all of them. It brought back connections with old characters, and it brought in new ones that felt real. I can fully say that this movie is the best movie I have seen, ever.

author: abdullahmassood
text:
Boom
Waohh, what a rollercoaster and thrilling 2 hours from start to end. It's another masterclass from Tom as he never disappoint. The performance from all cast is amazing with powerful storyline.

author: jonathanfirby
text:
Maybe my hopes were too high but I was let down
The original had everything. A believable story line, great characters, dog fights and whilst a serious script it had some classic one liners. I know it off by heart having watched it over 100 times.

TG Maverick abandons all of this other than the amazing flying scenes - in fact that is the only thing that saves the film.

Far too many nods to the original - it got cheesy by the end.

The script was like something out of Mission Impossible. In fact that is what the premise of the film was - an impossible mission. But with this impossible mission everyone came home apart from poor Ice Man who's death and funeral only took about 24 hours - probably the fastest in US history.

The first half of the film felt empty as we caught up with

author: jonathanfirby
text:
- probably the fastest in US history.

The first half of the film felt empty as we caught up with what Maverick has been up to for the last 20 or so years but in reality we didn't learn much. The last half was action packed but only just managed to save the movie.

I'd have loved to have spent less time with the Maverick catch up, less time with the shoehorned Penny Benjamin and more time learning about the pilots. This could have been a perfect segway into a 3rd Top Gun with Rooster and Hangman taking over the Maverick and Ice Man rivalry.

I desperately wanted to walk out of the cinema having loved it - I wanted to text all my mates saying how good it was but I couldn't. I rattled off a couple of sentences surmising the plot to my wife and realised how silly it all was:

Maverick

author: jonathanfirby
text:
f a couple of sentences surmising the plot to my wife and realised how silly it all was:

Maverick is a test pilot or a secret plane - he takes it up against orders and blows it up - doesn't get sacked as Ice Man conveniently phones up as it happens and brings him back to Top Gun for an impossible mission that no one else in the world can train people for - he trains them - gets sacked - steals a plane and completes impossible mission - gets his job back - flies impossible mission - gets shot down without parachute opening and is fine - Rooster saves him - gets shot down - they meet up and steal an old plane - shoot down 2 super jets and save the day - then they land and they then make up and work on planes together.

I don't know, maybe I'm being harsh. Knock 30 mins off the start wit

author: jonathanfirby
text:
and work on planes together.

I don't know, maybe I'm being harsh. Knock 30 mins off the start with all the Maverick and Penny stuff and it would have been pretty awesome.

Will probably watch it another 99 times.

author: imaginarilybe
text:
Entertaining...for some
Go see this movie if you:
are infatuated with Tom Cruise
love US armed forces promos
love, but don't know much about fighter jets, military air operations, or the military in general
love romantic stories
don't care about facts or logic


Otherwise, you will be disappointed, to say the least.

author: jrlaamanen
text:
Second Best Sequel EVER made
I truly believe Terminator 2: Judgment Day to be the greatest sequel ever made.

However this came damn close. Nothing is ever at this level.

Everything about this movie was absolutely perfect. I as a fan of the first movie as well as Tom's work was blown away. Anyone who's followed the movie scene in the last few years have seen the reboots and so called sequels Hollywood has pumped out to try to cash on the Nostalgia. Some of the efforts are better than others, but most left a bad taste in your mouth and even tainted the first film's legacy.

The technical aspects were amazing, excellent editing, incredible stunts, endless practical effects which is the way it should ALWAYS be done but unfortunately hasn't been for some time, and never on this level.

author: jrlaamanen
text:
way it should ALWAYS be done but unfortunately hasn't been for some time, and never on this level.

Tom Cruise brings another killer performance as you'd expect, but everyone is on their A-Game.

This movie is faithful to it's original as a sequel, I loved the plot points that were brought into the new film, as well as continuing on with Iceman and Goose's legacies. Rooster is a spitting image of his old man, and the way the story handled it was perfect. Just like the original movie, there was incredibly emotional scenes that you felt as if you were there. Many films cannot capture this lightning in a bottle and often come off arrogant or downright stupid.

Growing up, I've always seen the greatest action movies (in my opinion) many times. But these were years and decades later enjo

author: jrlaamanen
text:
n the greatest action movies (in my opinion) many times. But these were years and decades later enjoyed on VHS or DVD in my living room. I am truly glad to have been able to go see this the way it was intended, on the big screen. As of writing this, I have seen the film 3 times, in a regular theatre with Dolby Atmos, Ultra AVX, Ultra AVX D-Box. It was still just as awesome the third time. I am planning to see it again when it comes to IMAX in my area.

If you're thinking about checking it out please do. But if you have just heard of it and haven't seen the original yet, make sure you catch up on it first as it contains a lot of things you'll need to know.

author: ethandyal
text:
Refreshing
As a film student the only word I have for this film was refreshing. It is so refreshing to see a truly well done film. Nothing as fluid as this film has come out since before the pandemic save a title or two. Such a breath a fresh air.

I went to watch this film with my father and as an 18 year old young man who never had the opportunity to see the original film in theaters could some how still feel the nostalgia radiating from this film. Maybe it was just rubbing off from all of the other middle aged men in the room whose dreams and fantasies were birthed from the original film back in 1986 but I believe it was the true magic that comes from the crew and the masterful mind of director Joseph Kosinski.

Such an amazing piece of art and a must see for all nostalgia seeking,

author: ethandyal
text:
director Joseph Kosinski.

Such an amazing piece of art and a must see for all nostalgia seeking, aviation loving persons. Even if you do not fit into those categories this film truly is a masterpiece in terms of fluidity and realism. Absolutely wonderful and amazing job to all who was involved in the creation of this work.

author: abundantlife-32046
text:
Epic made for the big screen - Tom is a Maverick
Better than the original, because it had to be. Everything about this movie is a 10! It left me feeling emotional and melancholy for the life I was leading in 1986, it was a different world that saw the original as a fun, adrenaline rush like none we had seen. The harshness of the world meant this movie was going to be darker. And it is. However. It was a far superior movie to the first Tom has aged with grace and has an attention to detail that I appreciate as a movie goer. Yes, there are references to the first movie, but because it needed to show that while everything changes, nothing really changes at all. No spoilers here. Just a huge TC fan who has seen it twice on opening weekend and will go for a third before it leaves the theaters.

author: drqshadow
text: Given the influence of rose-tinted nostalgia and the remarkable staying power of the original, Tom Cruise and company could be forgiven for just running everything back and cashing it in for the Top Gun sequel. And, as far as the plot is concerned, that‚Äôs pretty much what they‚Äôve done. Sure, we‚Äôll see a few mild distinctions, plus a shift in perspective (Cruise certainly isn‚Äôt going to play a student pilot, nor is he apt to give up that top billing), but the bones are essentially the same. Cocky kids in an elite dogfight academy are ordered to set aside their differences and accomplish an impossible mission in hostile airspace. Adrenaline, testosterone and pheromones run wild. We even get a reprisal of the YouTube-famous beach volleyball scene. It‚Äôs a fitting tribute and a worthy successor

author: drqshadow
text:
reprisal of the YouTube-famous beach volleyball scene. It‚Äôs a fitting tribute and a worthy successor, modernized to suit today‚Äôs high-end home theater equipment, but not half as gloriously ‚Äò80s-tastic as the first film.

Where Maverick really soars (if you‚Äôll pardon the awful pun) is in a technical sense. This was evidently an area of special concern for the filmmakers, and they deserve special credit for the accomplishment. All that work to embed an array of super-resolution cameras into the pilot‚Äôs seat has paid off: this is a major level-up moment, on par with the very best IMAX showpieces. Paired with a persistent soundtrack of strained grunts and rapid breathing, the footage does a fantastic job of conveying the intense physical effort that‚Äôs required to maintain control of a fighte

author: drqshadow
text: ntastic job of conveying the intense physical effort that‚Äôs required to maintain control of a fighter jet, while also portraying the stunning vistas and dizzying speeds of afterburner combat. More than just special effects for a film, Maverick‚Äôs vision of airborne cinema borders on a true life experience. As a film, it‚Äôs a light-hearted flex of the bicep, designed to pluck memory threads and evoke warm feelings established by the original. Worthwhile, especially for long-term fans, but not particularly special. The cockpit scenes, though, especially that blood-rushing one-cut takeoff from the aircraft carrier, will stick with me for a long while.

author: przybylop
text:
This is one of the rare perfect movies I've seen. It's not overwhelmingly profound or epic, but every line of dialogue, every casting choice, and every shot serves their purpose perfectly. No wasted movements or scenes. It can be used to teach "How to build a satisfying blockbuster" class for years to come. It goes big, it gets weighty enough with existential issues, and it has enough twist and turns to make you question if the aging protagonist is supposed to survive this. 

Cruise is at his best as the equal parts vulnerable and cocky Maverick. His instant chemistry with Connelly makes you believe the latter was really in the original/first Top Gun. Supporting roles are hit with expert precision.

Ultimately, Top Gun: Maverick doesn't try to be anything that it isn't. It reaches all

author: przybylop
text:
recision.

Ultimately, Top Gun: Maverick doesn't try to be anything that it isn't. It reaches all of its goals (action, star-driven, thoughtful, nostalgic, fun, suspense) effortlessly.

author: extrashotlatte
text:
For a sequel no one knew they wanted, asked for, or expected, Top Gun: Maverick was one of the best (if not the best) film of 2022, which reminds us why Tom Cruise is one of the few legitimate superstars of our time.

By now most people would have seen this film, which takes place 30 years after the events of the first Top Gun. Tom Cruise steps into this role effortlessly, and supported by a cast which is both clich√© and endearing. Arrogant guy, chip on shoulder guy, takes-no-crap girl, goofy/nervous guy‚Ä¶ but before you can start an eye roll, you find yourself rooting for these characters.

Cinematography, visual effects, practical effects all marry with such precision the resulting visuals are nothing short of breathtaking. The training sequence through the simulated route and dog fig

author: extrashotlatte
text:
als are nothing short of breathtaking. The training sequence through the simulated route and dog fights give us a glimpse of what is to come. Combine this scintillating action with high stakes, impeccable acting and an absolute-gut punch of nostalgia, this film warrants multiple viewings. The sound design is remarkable. Both at the cinema and at home with a Dolby Atmos capable sound system, this film roars to life from all around you, and even overhead. If you caught this film in 4D ‚Äì how good was it!

This film feels like the old Hollywood blockbusters where there‚Äôs a goal with some history/character arc, and the goal is ultimately achieved with struggle and growth along the way. Dialogue and chemistry between characters feels natural and real, which ground the otherwise the over-the-to

author: extrashotlatte
text:
and chemistry between characters feels natural and real, which ground the otherwise the over-the-top plot.

Top Gun: Maverick is simple storytelling that doesn‚Äôt deconstruct established characters or lore, and that allows newcomers to earn their place.

author: CoolBR
text:
A good movie with a remarkable story and good action scenes also represents the dogfights well.

But, honestly, the movie lacks depth. The enemy country in the movie isn't even cited in the name. Worse yet, there aren't any named enemies, which is a shame, even if the enemy country is wrong it would be good to know why they are fighting for, instead they choose to burn a lot of screentime for a melodramatic relationship between the protagonist and one of his students/comrade (Rooster).

author: BasilZero
text: Not as good as the first Top Gun. A lot of the plot is pretty much a recycled re-telling except the main character is a instructor instead of a student. The new characters were not as memorable as the original cast of characters. The action scenes were nicely done however the ending act was just laughable and kind of makes you wish it was not included. It was so forced and felt like it would have been better if they did not have that last part of the movie.

author: Tiger_X
text:
Top Gun peaks in the very first scene wherein Maverick takes a cutting edge jet/spaceship to record breaking speed. We never see this awesome jet again or the intensity of this scene repeated. The entire rest of the movie features slow outdated airplanes in an attempt to save money and help the studio cash-in on nostalgia.

The supporting cast is almost as listless as Iceman's cameo. They rehash the entire Goose story in a really weird way with his son, Rooster! Finally, they tack on a new Maverick romance for no apparent reason (but to include the "Labyrinth girl") that is cringe and goes nowhere. Every single joke falls flat and the dog fights are not as realistic as the first movie.

Bottom line: Would never watch this movie again past scene #1 but I've watched the original Top Gun

author: tonyGreen
text:
The plot and cast of characters is a almost a beat-for-beat remake of the first film in parts. There is completely superfluous romance, unlike in the first film where it was a key plot point.
This film definitely caters to in a large part to the audience of the 1985 film 'Top Gun'. The score reuses a lot of the original film's score, definitely a lot of nostalgia smuggled in. Some of this comes across as slightly ludicrous. For example Iceman, sorry *Hangman*, is a big fan of Foghat and their 1975 hit "Slow Ride".

But the film stands out for it's great aerial action sequences, they really are spectacular, and the conflict and pressure around those really lifts the sense of peril for the characters.

The (unidentified) foreign nuclear program is destroyed, American Exceptionlism trium

author: Achaern
text: It's a rare time an audience is so willfully disrespected by the writers of the film. To suggest there is no longer any need for even the smallest amount of context for who the bad guy is suggests this is really just about American Exceptionalism. "It's right when we do it!". The entire story pretext centres around murdering scientists, despite the movie not being about anything more than showboating airplanes. Maverick is a shallow, shallow character we never needed to revisit. This needs literally 10 more minutes in the writing room to make sense. The action sequences were well shot but so dumb, especially the Mach 10 sequence at the start where the movie jumped the shark right away. This could have been a *great* movie if Tom was never in the cockpit and essentially played the role Ed H

author: AnActorExplains
text:
There is very little to be said about Top Gun: Maverick; that‚Äôs because it‚Äôs as close to flawless as a Hollywood production can get: Exhilarating cinematography, excellent audio both in fore and in background, premiere acting, a vibrant palette of colors in varied locations, and, most importantly, impeccable writing the likes of which we rarely see in this soulless, sellout era of film and television.

This movie has an incredibly diverse cast, with all the accompanying bells and whistles, and without any of the conceited, self-serving pretense of modern woke culture.  Top Gun: Maverick presents the argument that any man, woman or person of color is capable of excellence without sacrificing plot, contriving script, or assassinating character. It does so without any need to present the fe

author: AnActorExplains
text: g plot, contriving script, or assassinating character. It does so without any need to present the female in the guise of a male in order to elevate her, and without the need to crucify the male lead in order to satisfy a resentful audience.                                                                                                                                                                             What is most admirable about this movie is how it delivers on incredibly human themes that are vital, now more than ever before, to our current culture. Screen writers Ehren Kruger, Eric Warren Singer, and Christopher McQuarrie seamlessly present extremely important themes such as selflessness, confidence, how to take a woman‚Äôs breath away, and how to create enduring friendships forge

author: AnActorExplains
text: essness, confidence, how to take a woman‚Äôs breath away, and how to create enduring friendships forged in competition. It even dares to present Commander ‚ÄúIceman‚Äù Kazansky in a rather female light, as a patient, supportive, and compassionate authority. Take that, intersectionality! Family members of the enlisted will appreciate how director Joseph Kosinski does his very best to relay the incredible depth of feeling and emotion that is saying goodbye to a loved one that is headed into battle. All of this while developing a flawed protagonist who struggles to overcome his demons and deliver the best man he can be.                                                                        "Top Gun: Maverick" is a true hero story, the likes of which we grew up on, and one that will inspire endless

author: AnActorExplains
text: Maverick" is a true hero story, the likes of which we grew up on, and one that will inspire endless generations to come.

author: CoreGamer1408
text: This felt like a movie from a much missed and beloved bygone era and if this movie had of come out in that era? Then this movie would of been like maybe a 8/10 on the action hero scale. A do or die seemingly suicide mission against a high tech generic bad guy faction. Surprisingly this film had some heartfelt feels in some places and not just the Iceman stuff. One of those feel good triumph over adversity type of movies for sure. On reflection after watching this several times now the rewatchability for this movie is off the scale.

author: valrond
text:
This movie is not perfect. No one is. But I'm giving it a 10. Why?. It's very good. It's better than the original Top Gun, it's well paced, it has likable characters, the story is simple (it's the death star trench basically), but a good movie doesn't need a complicated story.
The flight scenes are great. Probably the best ever in a movie. It uses quite a bit of nostalgia without abusing it.
But above all, this movie is very entertaining, as it should be. And it makes you feel GOOD when you watch it. You just can't ask for more.

author: Maulcun
text:
I thought making a sequel to Top Gun wasn't a great idea until I saw this. Top Gun Maverick is easily one of the best movies that I've ever seen.

First of all, this movie doesn't make jokes at the expense of it's predecessor, pays tribute to the original in all ways it can , manages to keep the spirit of the original alive and yet surpass all expectations.

It is well written, good acting by all the supporting actors, great background score, beautiful action sequences, great direction and the movie teaches valuable lessons about life.

This will be one of the few movies I watch for a second time.

author: DHReviews
text: While it may be hard for some to return to the Top Gun world after such a long distance between the films, Tom Cruise and company bring the franchise back into the limelight with the force of a F16. While nervous about the film in general, I knew I would have a good time watching it thanks to the sheer fact that Tom Cruise does nothing halfway. The cinematography within each cockpit, unique in its execution, is the major highlight of the film. While some aspects such as a relatively lackluster script and some average acting by supporting characters keep Top Gun: Maverick from reaching truly death-defying heights, lovers of popcorn movies will feel right at home and rightly thrilled. An enjoyable flight to say the least.

author: Miclazz
text:
I do not think this movie surpasses the original. It has no originality and will not to capture the imagination of a new generation. I do not think there will be any fun moments emulated and cemented into pop culture like the original had. In fact all those moments are simply recreated in the new movie.

The script and story is sub-par (no memorable lines) and I didn't feel any emotion for the characters. One area where they seemed to spend a lot of time and money is in the aerial cinematography and actually flying the actors while being filmed, and all you see as far as online reviews go is real-world pilots being asked to rate the flight scenes on their realism. Ok, great. But that doesn't for a good film make! I just wouldn't care to watch it again. I feels like Top Gun original meets

author: Miclazz
text:
't for a good film make! I just wouldn't care to watch it again. I feels like Top Gun original meets "Iron Eagle" (from a story and acting perspective) + "Star Wars IV" (for how they essentially copied the destruction of the Death Star scene as the finale and highlight to the action).

There was no magic or chemistry between the actors, nor the intensity of the scenes like the original.
The music is recreated to a large degree and that's ok, but I'll take the grainy and raw cinematography of the original with it's creative use of scoring and editing and close up shots over this remake any day.

It is entertaining as a fun action movie, if you don't compare it to the Tony Scott original, ignore the cringeworthy premise of the "mission" they are training for and don't count the many sce

text: ignore the cringeworthy premise of the "mission" they are training for and don't count the many scenes, shoe-horned into the movie, for the sake of nostalgia. Basically completely forgettable.

author: evilspeculator
text:
Amazing piece of cinema. Tremendous camera work.

They opted not to green screen the action just because it was hard to shoot paid off. You can almost see the green screen in most of today's movies because the directors, actors, and audience have gotten lazy. This movie finally breaks that expectation and returns you to a more believable experience.

The writing is excellent but not perfect. They could have explored the relationship between Maverick and Penny a bit more. Instead, it feels like an afterthought.

What's amazing is that they honored the original and improved on it. Maverick will go down as one of the greatest sequels ever made.

text: Top Gun: Maverick is an extremely entertaining, fun, and engaging movie. author: Kaonazhie
text: Super fun movie. Almost not worth watching if you can't catch it in the cinema, as that experience is the one to go for. That said, even then it's a nice (if fairly standard) action movie with action-movie trope characters. Hits all the right sort of notes you'd expect, but the real star is obviously the aerial segments, which are ambitious and impressive. First film that got me back in the cinema since 2019.

author: eded9999
text:
It is a complete nostalgia feast? Yes.

It is full of fan-service? Yes.

Is Tom Cruise interpreting Tom Cruise again? Yes.

And that's exactly what i was needing in this sea of crap Hollywood produce this days. THIS is entertainment, not BS, no woke message, just 2 hours of "forget the real word" and enjoy a good, high budget, movie-star package, action blockbuster that respect and embrace the legacy of the IP their are using, no preaching, no hate to the original fans, just pure unadulterated entertainment.

Production is top tier, acting is good. I have nothing bad to say, the story is simple and there's a lot "movie licenses" with the stunts they do on the air, but that's it, the rest is a unapologetic and badass movie.

author: nnogohko
text: This definitely is a must watch on IMAX. The flight sequences will make your jaw drop and the rumbling of the engines of those jets will stir your souls. This is an extremely simple but decent drama as well and of course Tom Cruise, Miles Teller, and Jennifer Connelly in particular really gives you the feels. Joseph Kosinski I think will finally be able to get multiple films to direct WITH A GOOD script after this one after Only the Brave disappointed financially. He directs the character scenes with a very nice touch and I especially loved the extended bar sequence where we get to meet the pilots. Although not as good as the last three Mission: Impossible movies in my opinion, this is another winner from Tom Cruise.

author: Chuker
text: It shows how a sequel has to be done. Great action scenes. Great music. Tom Cruise has a pact with the devil

author: Butterballer1
text: With low expectations going in, this film blew the entire audience away.  A sequel to a movie that no one was asking for, but it single-handedly revives the Western and American archetypes in a story that is universal and powerful.  Manages to hit all the right notes, and because it is sincere and heartfelt, the moments of disbelief are incredible--like a modern myth.  There hasn't been a film this good from Hollywood in years.  Going forward, I will never mock Tom Cruise without also implying my own extreme reverence.  Making this film the way he did required an intense amount of creative dominance over the studios and the ESG mob.  Hopefully, this film and the work of Cruise and the director inspire others to make films like this again rather than another 10 years of uninspiring bland ca

author: Butterballer1
text: or inspire others to make films like this again rather than another 10 years of uninspiring bland cardboard.

author: RoccoCille
text: This movie is a modern rarity, because it is a completely old school classically produced film, which is real action and character focused above all else.  It pays respectful homage to the origin story, and beautifully interlinks many characters to the current one.  This is actually better than the original, it‚Äôs more subtle, but has some fantastic dynamics on so many different levels.  One of the best movies I have seen produced by Hollywood in years, without any gross politics trying to be shoved into it, just a pure story with realistic characters and a well developed story arc across the board.  I also liked that Maverick is represented as flawed, now aging, but still the incredible talent that adds value to the younger generation of pilots. Highly recommended, this is definitely a mov

author: RoccoCille
text: nt that adds value to the younger generation of pilots. Highly recommended, this is definitely a movie I will watch many times.

Tom Cruise unsurpassed and in general it seems like a movie made with love and not a stupid and meaningless fan service. The scenes and cinematography are worth seeing. Good job 10/10

author: fatihqibrit
text: Best blockbuster ever!! after the coronavirus and cinema's lack of quality, this movie wakes up the cinema. top gun maverick one of best in 2022. movie came out imay but still getting top 5 place in the august. dominate box office. tom cruise's most money win movie. what else do you want? everything was perfect in this movie.

author: JonoFitz
text: Great movie, especially if you liked the first one. Other than a few cheesy bits which is expected from a Top Gun movie it's a good watch.

author: grimsfield
text:
This movie just isn't as good as its hyped up to be. The first movie was better, and as unrealistic as that was, this is far more ridiculous. If you can get past the mountain of plot holes though, and the overly simple  rinse and repeat story, you'll probably enjoy this. All in all this felt akin to what home alone 2 did for home alone 1. Same basic story of the first movie, just reskinned.

oh and the Jenifer Connolly / tom cruise, totally superficial romance plotline came off like a cialis commercial.

author: kenedy11
text: √â uma aula de cinema comparado com muito filmes e series que vemos hoje. Me prendeu do inicio at√© o fim.

author: nicorzF1
text: The perfect sequel for such a classic. It seems that not always 'second parts aren't ever good' happens.

author: gracjanski
text:
The very good ratings are not fakes. The movie is very good:
It is not only about action, the beautiful pictures especially the wide angle perspectives from the jets and the support from Pentagon with military aircraft. Tom Cruise is perfect and his character is well written. Also I like the critics about the hierarchy in the military, that was great.
The only thing I didnt like? Of course this movie is very political correct ("strong women" in the beginning -.- ) and US propaganda (of course USA is allowed to bomb enemy nuclear **** problem). And some of the scenes resembled too much to the first Top Gun. In the beginning I was even thinking if I downloaded the right movie, lol. Anyways in my view this Top Gun is even better than the first one.

author: rspecial1
text: Best movie I've seen in recent times,  Congratulations! Just a lot of fun with lots of nostalgic nods to the original. Tom Cruise is spectacular!!

author: snorkiss
text: I feel the NEED! The NEED for a better sequel! - After hearing all the rave reviews I must admit to being a little bewildered, this is one of the dumbest films I've ever seen?! Just because it's not woke doesn't mean it's good. The script and acting are both nearly as terrible as Tom's hair dye. They should make a Top Gun Three-Some and bring back Meg Ryan and Kelly McGillis  - 5 stars for the admittedly great flying footage that for some reason reminded me of Star Wars?

author: sce2aux
text: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

author: Amiam
text: Most people focus on the action, the jets, the technology, the adrenaline of the flight sequences, but this movie is truly, and authentically only about thing: Relationships.  From Iceman's "You have to let go" to the "Don't think" lines, the inner core of this movie's soul is about how we as human beings navigate pain, loss, friendships, and brotherhood. And ultimately, how....despite it all, we must continue living past the pain of death and loss. THIS is why this movie is beautiful. THIS is why you can hear a pindrop while you watch it. THIS is why.

author: Cosmix
text:
This is probably the best sequel ever made.
I'd even say it was better than the original.
I absolutely loved it and I don't have any idea why some of the "official" critics have scored it low.

text: A fun movie and defiantly a step up from the original. But I think it has been overrated a little bit as it was very predictable and some of the characters were too cheesy. A solid 7/10

author: turdlemckay
text: Epic. Amazing. I've seen it more than once and still want to see it again. Its better than I expected.

author: ozymandias79
text: What did I just see? A movie respecting established characters. In the woke version, Maverick is a broken hobo called back to teach a team of lesbians who are already perfect in every way and teach him not to be a pathetic loser.

author: liamexe
text:
This is what you want from your entertainment‚Äîfunny material to watch, without any BS or forced politics.

One of the few movies in recent memory that genuinely kept me on the edge of my seat in the theatre, the action was great with either no or very little cgi.

author: JetL
text: Best movie in the nearest decade. Everything is perfect. The script,bgms,songs,conflicts between **** makes your jaws drop down every single second during this film. I went into the cinema with a normal state of mind. It is incredible to make a teenager to love this film with just two hours. I have never watched top gun(1986)before. This is a movie that everyone an fully enjoy and take a rollercoaster ride with Tom Cruise.

author: UncleWillard
text: A solid sequel to the original with very few surprises. Lacked some of the charm of the original, but upped the ante on the flying action.

author: dshadowalker
text: One of the best cinema experience in years, It went into my top movie list.

author: Voodoo123
text: The fantastic cinematography and cast come together in a rare moment in which a sequel released so long after the original surpasses it so convincingly. Somehow it feels like anime levels of team bonding cheesiness mixed with military aircraft erotica and yet somehow it works for me. Very entertaining in an 80's cheesy way. Also as noted by several other reviews it's great to watch a film that isn't charged with the woke political garbage that has plagued all of Hollywood lately.

author: scho22
text: My life movie: full of action, humour and a touching story behind  Well made indeed. Leaves a lingering message that will shock me always: past is past, time to let go    Never regret, and move towards the future

author: caungardh
text: Actual good fun movie in 2022!!! Is this the real life? Is this just fantasy?

author: vgmkyle
text: The King of Kings. Proof you can make a film without jumping on some politically, woke soap-box. It's a thrilling film with a cast that is talented before anything else. Refreshing.

text: tacky, boring, horribly acted, annoying, we left half way, couldn't stand it anymore

text: Flawless masterpiece. See it in the theater. Great sound design and music, all the acting in top notch.

author: Masemola
text: The storyline is great, and the action kept me on the edge of my seat. It is my best movie of 2022 so far.

author: argentshard
text:
Blatant propaganda film, and the actual mission is just a retreaded Star Wars Death Star assault, but still handled fairly well.

I appreciate that they continue the tradition of not identifying the antagonist faction/OPFOR, and actually got to fly the jets thanks to Cruise's demands.

The only cons I have with it are that it's a bit of a nostalgia trip, they think F/A-16s can somehow compete against SU-35s. (You are horribly mistaken if you think this is the case), and that once again America thinks they are liberator and goes to unnamed country to bomb them because "they aren't allowed their own nuclear deterrence"...

but sure, good propaganda film.

author: MarkHReviews
text:
‚ÄúTop Gun: Maverick‚Äù is an exhilarating film with no pretensions.  It just wants to be a first-rate diversion on a hot, humid summer afternoon.  By that measure, it exceeds expectations.  If you‚Äôre looking for an existential assessment of the human condition, go see ‚ÄúEverything Everywhere All at Once.‚Äù  If you want to examine the nature and texture of relationships, check out ‚ÄúBrian and Charles‚Äù or ‚ÄúMarcel the Shell with Shoes On.‚Äù  ‚ÄúMaverick‚Äù is an unapologetic adrenaline rush that doesn‚Äôt have time to probe the darker corners of the human psyche.  So just sit back and savor Tom Cruise reprising his most iconic role.

This film works for three reasons: its visuals, its tone and what happens when there aren‚Äôt jets in the air.  Visually, ‚ÄúMaverick‚Äù is simply spectacular.  The dogfights and

author: MarkHReviews
text:
s when there aren‚Äôt jets in the air.  Visually, ‚ÄúMaverick‚Äù is simply spectacular.  The dogfights and other aerial shots are all real, not CGI.  When you see the g-forces pressing on Tom Cruise‚Äôs face, that‚Äôs real.  This commitment to reality makes these action scenes even more riveting.

The tone of the film is equally skilled.  It‚Äôs self-referential without being self-absorbed.  There‚Äôs a bar where there are renditions of ‚ÄúGreat Balls of Fire.‚Äù  There is beach football substituting for beach volleyball.  The admiral‚Äôs daughter (referenced in the original but never seen) shows up.  Most of all, there‚Äôs an appearance by Val Kilmer, who played fighter pilot ‚ÄúIceman‚Äù in the original.  Here, he‚Äôs an admiral whose body is failing because of cancer.  He can speak only with great effort.  (In r

author: MarkHReviews
text:
e‚Äôs an admiral whose body is failing because of cancer.  He can speak only with great effort.  (In real life, Kilmer has battled throat cancer.  His brief speaking parts in ‚ÄúMaverick‚Äù are computer-generated.)

Finally, in ‚ÄúMaverick‚Äù the story keeps its footing even when it‚Äôs on the ground.  The original film was littered with excruciating dialogue filled with tortured clich√©s (‚ÄúYour ego is writing checks your body can‚Äôt cash.‚Äù).  And because of Director Tony Scott‚Äôs advertising background, ‚ÄúTop Gun‚Äù featured way too many locker room scenes that just looked like product placement for Jockey briefs. By comparison, ‚ÄúMaverick‚Äù offers a cornucopia of interesting tidbits.  There‚Äôs a height-appropriate love interest for Cruise. (Jennifer Connelly is excellent.)  There‚Äôs also a surrogate father-

author: MarkHReviews
text:
priate love interest for Cruise. (Jennifer Connelly is excellent.)  There‚Äôs also a surrogate father-son dynamic between Maverick and Goose‚Äôs son.  As a special bonus, Maverick appears incrementally more self-aware.  There‚Äôs even a female fighter pilot vying to become the gender-neutral alpha dog.

The plot is almost an afterthought.  After taking an experimental aircraft to Mach 10 in an opening scene, Maverick is assigned back to Top Gun School to train pilots for a suicide mission.  An unidentified rogue nation is engaging in uranium enrichment.  Maverick has to train pilots who will blow up the enrichment plant before this country can develop nuclear capability that will threaten civilization.  And so on.

A storyline that can be charitably described as ‚Äúimplausible‚Äù in no way detra

author: MarkHReviews
text:
zation.  And so on.

A storyline that can be charitably described as ‚Äúimplausible‚Äù in no way detracts from the fun of this film.  In one of the three (count ‚Äòem, three) climactic scenes, Maverick and his team attack the rogue nation, a country with plentiful evergreen trees and snow on the ground.  The uranium enrichment facility is three minutes from the coast.  Go to the biggest screen you can find to watch Tom Cruise bomb Norway.

author: Higgidan
text:
This was an inspirational piece of film by all involved and especially you know who.

My laugh out loud moment was when they seemed to improvise. I had the freedom to watch in one of Londons oldest cinemas, as they are called now. It is community ran currently. The local newspaper was nice and interesting. I found it on Google. I could not justify the exhorbirant price of the IMAX. The staff were very nice and I learned a lot from the guys at the desk. Definitely a ten because I felt the whole thing, and feel a lot better, now.

author: TheGreenRoom
text: To be fair, this movie does one thing extremely well. The jet flying sequences in this movie is top notch cinema, and it was extremely real and authentic without use of CGI. However, the greatness of the jet flying cannot overcome the ridiculousness of everything else in the movie. The dialogue was weird and cringe. Nothing about it seemed real and authentic unlike the jet flying. The love story was completely useless, and the plot is nonsense. It made me feel like the protagonists were the bad guys. Why would I root for someone who is going to other countries and dropping bombs on them unprovoked? This movie is nothing but a military propaganda film. Huge action and explosions with a weak plot and no substance. That's Hollywood for you.

author: TheWaffle
text: Sometimes it just feels like I watched an entirely different movie than everyone else. The characters were paper thin, the dialogue was barebones, and the film was obsessed with callbacks to the original. I couldn't take the plot seriously, the mission they're training for is psychotically suicidal, and I couldn't even enjoy the aerial sequences since they ignored the laws of physics and just followed Anime-logic. I dunno, I must've just seen a different movie than everyone else.

author: Vadertime
text: I remember seeing the first Topgun movie some 30 years ago. My wife and I caught it at the discount theater since it was already several weeks into it's run back then. We liked it, but I have never seen it again and it's not in my DVD collection. This one, Maverick, will definitely be in my DVD collection and after watching it this weekend in the theater, I may go watch it again in the theater. After the first 15 minutes, this movie is a rollercoaster ride with edge-of-your-seat thrills. In the 36 hours since I saw the movie, I continue to re-run it in my head. This one is so much better than the original, even with Tom Cruise in his late 50s when he made the movie - he's 60 now. I'm a few years older than him and I did not want to see an old  Tom Cruise in a Topgun movie, but I was very p

author: BlackSteelApexx
text: Definitely not the Citizen Kane of our time, as one might errantly infer from the rave reviews both from critics and audiences. It‚Äôs always plainly obvious when a film studio sells out to the Department of Defense and allows them veto power over the script for the sake of getting military cooperation in terms of consultation and provisioning equipment for the film itself. The plot seems to openly embrace U.S.‚Äôs love for military adventurism, with the focal point centering around the planning of an airstrike on a uranium enrichment center that ‚Äúviolates a NATO treaty‚Äù. Who‚Äôs the ‚Äúrogue state‚Äù operating the plant? What jurisdiction or right does the U.S. have to just bomb it? Because they feel like it? This is the early 2000‚Äôs Iraqi Freedom brand of warhawking that even the Republicans party

author: BlackSteelApexx
text: like it? This is the early 2000‚Äôs Iraqi Freedom brand of warhawking that even the Republicans party has tried to distance itself from as of late. But then again, the DoD controls the script‚Ä¶ and so not only is this presented as completely okay, but never are these moral concerns even addressed. So perhaps it‚Äôs better to just turn one‚Äôs brain off and view the movie through an appropriate lens - 2 hours of DoD propaganda that‚Äôs good for some action shots of (undeniably) stunning and beautiful fighter aircraft. However, the movie‚Äôs odd pacing and inter-splicing of a needless romance only serve to detract from what this movie could do well - being a 2-hour theme park ride showing the F-18 and its Russian opponents duking it out. The actual airstrike and dogfights afterwards in fact are so hur

author: BlackSteelApexx
text: ts Russian opponents duking it out. The actual airstrike and dogfights afterwards in fact are so hurried towards the tail end of the film and short-lived that it feels like a lot of waiting for high-stakes action beyond the pre-mission training exercises, that the wait hardly feels worth it. It‚Äôs a good movie if you‚Äôve got 2 hours to kill, but this movie is extremely overrated and held back by poor acting, strange pacing, unwelcome side plots, and a criminally short dogfight sequence that, if it were much longer, would have GREATLY improved my opinion of the movie overall.

author: mxs1438
text:
I saw this movie yesterday and I can't stop thinking about it. I thought the original Top Gun was a great movie and it was a big surprise that 35+ years later, a sequel was made.

The sequel is based on the original Top Gun and takes the movie to new levels that are astonishing in many different ways. Obviously, the action scenes are completely amazing. Beyond that, this is a movie very much about relationships. Relationships about teams and relationships focusing on 1-1 dynamics. Painful history with a lot of hope and suspense to see how it unfolds.

In the end, the most significant aspect of this movie is Tom Cruise‚Äôs performance. He truly inhabits the character Maverick. Tom Cruise is one of the best actors of the 20th and 21st century and he proves it again and again in this movie.

author: theredsky
text: Miles better than the original 1986 film and one of my favorite sequels of all time. God this film is just awesome. That‚Äôs the best way to describe it; awesome. The flying is awesome, the characters are awesome, the music is awesome, and the action is awesome. Tom Cruise‚Äôs dedication to making realistic action films with little to no visual effects has paid off incredibly well here. The flying scenes were filmed practically but they look amazing. Some of if not the best shot sequences of the year so far. I absolutely adore how they look and it‚Äôs amazing that the actors were able to act in those conditions. They all do a great job acting. Tom Cruise, Miles Teller, and Glen Powell are all standouts here and their respective characters and journeys were really well done and even compelling at

author: theredsky
text: douts here and their respective characters and journeys were really well done and even compelling at points. Val Kilmer did a great job as well under his own personal circumstances. The film handles Kilmer‚Äôs medical condition and character incredibly respectfully. It‚Äôs a great handling of his character. The action here is awesome. It‚Äôs incredibly well thought out and intense. You could know or predict the outcome of a scene and you could still feel your heart beating out of your chest just because of how well done the action is. It‚Äôs genuinely some of the best action in a blockbuster that I‚Äôve seen in a long time. The final action scene itself is probably my favorite action scene of the year. It‚Äôs absolutely amazing and so much better than the final fight in the original film because it‚Äôs

author: theredsky
text: . It‚Äôs absolutely amazing and so much better than the final fight in the original film because it‚Äôs actually set up. The music here from the original Top Gun composer, Lady Gaga, and Hans Zimmer is great! The soundtrack itself isn‚Äôt near as good as the original 86 film but it‚Äôs still great here. I can‚Äôt wait to see how Cruise breaks the mold with action again in the future. This is a must see from me for everyone. This film deserves to break $1 Billion at the box office so go see it now!

text: Loved the original Top Gun movie, even named my dog Maverick after the movie but thought this one fell a little short. author: robomartion
text: It's really visceral edge of your seat no nonsense entertainment. Its biggest downfall is also its greatest and most stand-out unique quality and that is it never delves into the area of fiction like a James Bond film and is realism all the way. It feels almost like a real life account of what it would be like to be in an elite air force. The practical effects. It also sets the bar on how to do a reboot and I'm sure will make a lot of people think about signing up to the Navy. It is a true American film and gets the full 10 for not labelling any particular country as the enemy as well as for minimal drama with no unnecessary bickering manufactured division between the crew. Its all about team work.

The majority of writers in Hollywood today are untalented weak minded hacks that are not capable of doing anything close.  The hero arc for Maverick is well crafted and the production had immense respect for the character.  This is a far cry from the majority of sequels and reboots made lately which seek to deconstruct and tear down beloved characters from the past in order to build up pathetic new characters that usually act like narcissists.  I will go see this movie again, and I haven't said that about a bi

author: dharma
text: After many decades, Tom Cruise returns to the blockbuster that put his name on the map, Top Gun. this film joined an elite group of sequels that are better than the original.  I can even say that it is one of the best Action film of the last decade. Amazing set pieces, cinematography and sound editing. Sequences filmed live, with the actors actually flying these fighter **** dropping to say the least.  This is a film that need to be seen in an IMAX screen, or the very least any kind of cinema.  However, all these razzle dazzle will be for naught without the human characters and that is what Top Gun excels in all front.  This may be the Tom Cruise show but is also an ensemble piece, with all actors in their A game.  One of the best film of 2022 so far.

author: drlowdon
text:
Thirty years since the events of the original film, Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is serving as a U.S. Navy test pilot when he is sent to act as an instructor for a group of elite pilots at the TOPGUN academy.

Top Gun Maverick is undoubtedly one of the best action movies of the last decade with absolutely staggering flight scenes that just have to be seen at the cinema. Even the plot, which is pretty much as predictable as it gets, somehow still manages to prove suitably emotional. Just a great movie all round.

author: Mattyice
text: Top Gun: Maverick ends up being one of those rare sequels that surpasses the original classic in almost every way. Adding depth and gravitas to the story, as well as gorgeous cinematography and stunt sequences, while retaining some of the cheesiness, humor, and charm that made the original an 80s icon. Tom Cruise is obviously the stand out of the cast with a fantastic and shockingly emotional performance, but the rest of the cast is great as well and the new pilots all have their own charm, although I did find Miles Teller's Rooster to be a bit miscast. The only cons I really have for the film are the fact that it's a bit too heavy on exposition for both Maverick and Penny's, as well as Maverick and Rooster's, relationships. It's depiction of the "enemy", which is clearly Russian/Chinese y

author: Mattyice
text: rick and Rooster's, relationships. It's depiction of the "enemy", which is clearly Russian/Chinese yet isn't stated as much or shown, is also odd, but studios want to make money and not get this movie banned from those countries, so it's understandable albeit clunky. Otherwise, Top Gun Maverick is one heck of a ride and a very worthy trip to the cinema.
