author: Halonut24
text:
It's a real treat in this day in age to have a sequel to a beloved classic film that actually fulfils the role of, well, a sequel. If you haven't seen it, or are debating seeing it, debate no longer. This is must-watch stuff right here. Go see it immediately.

To be entirely truthful, I fully expected this film to suffer from the same pitfalls all of these sequel/remakes do in today's age; to spit in the faces of the original, and re-make it in their own twisted image. Re-write characters to fit a new narrative. Break down their legacy into something unrecognizable. Like what Disney did to Star Wars over the past decade.
To my utter amazement, it never did. Not even a little bit. Every second of this film was totally respectful to it's 1986 predecessor. Almost all action seen is practic

author: Halonut24
text: cond of this film was totally respectful to it's 1986 predecessor. Almost all action seen is practical. Those F-18's were real F-18's, flown by real people, filmed with real cameras, and it's a sight to behold. The sound design beautifully translates the incredible power these machines possess. It's characters remain untarnished from revisionism. Maverick is still the same Maverick we knew all those years ago. The new characters are written realistically, with care and diligence. Our hero's struggles are approached with dignity and respect. Ulterior motives, personal politics, all absent from the film. With all of it wrapped in just the perfect amount of nostalgia tastefully sprinkled throughout the 2 hour runtime. Enough to harken back to it's roots, and tug on a few heart-strings, but it

author: Halonut24
text: hout the 2 hour runtime. Enough to harken back to it's roots, and tug on a few heart-strings, but it never dwells on it. Something this authentic and genuine needs to be openly praised and cherished. This is what we should expect sequels, and to that extent action films in general, to be. What a wonderful surprise.

author: HowToBen
text: Top Gun: Maverick is a phenomenal example of modern-age cinematography. The 3-year delay for this movie is justified by the final product we are fortunate to see. It is far too common that Sequels for Standalone films are produced purely for 'nostalgia money' but Top Gun: Maverick is an anomaly of modern-age filmmaking. My respect for the cast and crew was further enhanced by the knowledge that they used practical effects and put the actors in actual Military-grade fighter aircraft. Too often are films quickly made and rushed with the use of CGI and it is incredibly refreshing to see a movie created with sheer passion and commitment to creating this sequel. I was not born to witness the original, but my Mother and her Friend's enjoyment in the cinema proved to me that this movie whilst bri

author: HowToBen
text:
inal, but my Mother and her Friend's enjoyment in the cinema proved to me that this movie whilst bringing a new plot, could also pay homage to the feeling of the original.

The story is told in a manner that is neither boring nor underplayed, and the return of iconic actors in a realistic way further enhances the respect given to the original. Although there are elements of the plot that are bland, the feeling of the movie suits the narrative. The actors all deserve huge credit, not only for their performance but also for their dedication with flight-training to partake in their roles to the best of their capabilities.

This is a great movie in a time of over-saturation and CGI, I am so refreshed to see a movie that does not rely on the use of CGI and soleless storytelling, more like t

author: HowToBen
text: refreshed to see a movie that does not rely on the use of CGI and soleless storytelling, more like this, please.

author: mickrussom
text: A rare sequel - this one is actually better than the original. If this was a stand alone movie it would be a seven/eight of ten. But as a sequel navigating the modern outrage mobs and other cantankerous spoilers and wreckers waiting in the wings to bring anything good down this thing is a solid ten. Tom Cruise doesn't look almost 60, he is in unreal shape for any age, but the work and dieting he must put in to look like this at 59 is nothing short of amazing. There is less cheese than was in the first movie, the music is great, and to see these people grunting and huffing while pulling real g-force maneuvers in real airplanes is so great. Tom Cruise had to take a huge amount of abuse to make this a reality - you can see the actors in planes sweating and suffering tunnel vision and black ou

author: mickrussom
text: this a reality - you can see the actors in planes sweating and suffering tunnel vision and black outs and redouts. One must have a healthy  respect for Tom Cruise for being one of the very very few in hollyweird that actually cares enough about his craft to put in the work. I hope this kicks off a new wave of serious remakes that can even outshine the original if done right and I hope this kicks off a new wave of movies that skip the idiotic computer generated trash and get back to practical effects like this movie. This is basically an 80's movie done right - take all the good music and good looking people, reduce the cheese and come up with an engaging multi-faceted multi-layered plot that develops emotion and take it to eleven on a scale of ten.

author: beefalo16
text:
Overall a good movie and worth a watch for anyone who enjoyed the first one. Definitely some fan service, but movie also holds up on its own.

Main complaints holding it back from a higher rating:
1) Really needed a large dogfight scene, feels like so much wasted potential here. We didn't get to see all the pilots in action and a lot of the training seemed like it was irrelevant.
2) Zero attempt to flesh out the enemy/mission, was extremely contrived. I get that the focus was on Maverick but this still felt a bit lazy.
3) Some of the dialog/acting from the new pilots was pretty bad.

author: TVJerry
text: More than 30 years later, Tom Cruise returns as the daring, renegade aviator from his original hit. His character is sent to teach a group of young pilots who are charged with an especially challenging mission. If you remember the original, there are lots of parallel scenes and relationships in this one, including a brief appearance by Val Kilmer. Basically, this film boils down to macho posturing peppered with flight footage and moments of romance. While the plot is predictable at every turn, the solid performances and tight editing help make it appealing. However, it's the spectacular aerial scenes that makes the movie memorable. It's a solid popcorn flick that's an appropriate follow up.

author: digitalkoimoi
text:
What‚Äôs Good: It‚Äôs not just action and visually shocking stunts that overpower the narrative, but an emotional story and a touching conflict that manages to grab your attention.

What‚Äôs Bad: The women in this universe are strong but don‚Äôt get enough to do. They support the men and that cannot be the only thing they get to do.

Loo Break: Please no, Tom Cruise is returning after decades and you cannot really miss even a single scene. Plus it‚Äôs in theatres, there will be intermission in India at least.

Watch or Not?: Miles Teller in an interview told me there is almost no green screen involved, if you won‚Äôt acknowledge this effort, who will?

author: AJ_13
text: Top Gun: Maverick gave me even more than I was expecting. A vibrant, immersive action film, beautifully shot and flawlessly crafted. text: Excellent popcorn flick made for the fans.  Excellent characterization and Easter Eggs along with homages to the previous movie.  I saw the original in the theater and glad Tom held out for this to be in the theater and a must see on a big screen with great sound.  My kids also enjoyed the movie and one had only just seen Top Gun recently and the other not at all.  Glad there was no hidden agenda.  Great to see all the practical filming aspects vs green screen.   I highly recommend this.

Tom Cruise is Ethan Hunt and Superman in a flight suit, it should have been called Mission (Im)Possible 8. But the dog fight scenes and all. that. machismo. are fun to watch while it lasts..

author: Mauro_Lanari
text:
(Mauro Lanari)
Sly had already tried it with the trilogy "The Expendables", an economic but not critical success: a dozen years ago the hangover of the planetary reviewers was aimed at crossmedialization (or globalization) and panned as "nostalgia operation" everything what was distant from the new trend. Instead Bruckheimer returns to produce not silly TV series but a blockbuster, calling back in their roles as film stars actors sold off to the fictions of the streaming platforms: Val Kilmer, Jennifer Connelly, Ed Harris. Not a masterpiece but not even the caricature of a blockbuster: fortunately it is not Bergman who plays chess with death, but it is the identical concept adapted for the masses ("Time is your worst enemy"). And it is also metacinematographic: the military mission to be

author: Mauro_Lanari
text: masses ("Time is your worst enemy"). And it is also metacinematographic: the military mission to be accomplished is feasible only by downgrading the paraphernalia and relying on the additional capabilities of the human factor so as to circumvent the digital supertechnology set up to fight something that on paper should no longer exist. This reminds the historic lose wars because of an arsenal suitable for pitched battles and not for guerrilla warfare. Havin' learned the lesson, passed the period of famine, victory is guaranteed. Ps: just to be clear, I have no memory of a single frame of Tony Scott's film.

author: MovieWarfare
text:
Firstly, the flying sequences are breathtaking and this is all because they did it practically. This is especially noticeable in the final act which is one of the best I've seen in recent memory. Additionally, the music score by Harold Faltermeyer, Lady Gaga, Hans Zimmer, & Lorne Balfe is very good. I love how they incorporated those 80s tracks into the film while giving more modern and fitting music as well. Furthermore, their music score during the intense action scenes are well done and helps to make the scenes tenser.

Tom Cruise is still great as Maverick even after almost 30 years. He still embodies the character perfectly and does feel like a natural evolution of his character from the first film. I genuinely believe that this is what Maverick would be like in 30 years. Miles Tell

author: MovieWarfare
text: the first film. I genuinely believe that this is what Maverick would be like in 30 years. Miles Teller is also great as Rooster, Goose's son, and he has great synergy with Tom Cruise in their scenes together. Jennifer Connelly plays the new love interest for Maverick, Penny, and she is also great in her role thanks to her great chemistry with Tom. Glen Powell plays the rival to Miles and he is very good at being this overly cocky, hateable guy. Likewise, Jon Hamm plays the commander that is antagonistic to Maverick and he also does a good job at being hateable as well. Val Kilmer is one of the few actors from the original to return and I was interested to see how they would handle his throat cancer situation in real life. Thankfully, this film handles it respectfully and probably results i

author: MovieWarfare
text:
cancer situation in real life. Thankfully, this film handles it respectfully and probably results in one of the most emotional scenes in the film. The rest of the supporting cast, including those who play the recruits, all do a good job as well.

Moreover, the story itself is also surprisingly enjoyable. The first Top Gun was a cheesy action flick but this one is a very down to earth, character-driven story. Maverick is a lot wiser now thanks to the character arc he got from the first film when he was a student. However, now he has to be the teacher and this is a great antithesis to the story in the first film. The conflict between Maverick and Rooster is the heart and soul of this film. This family dynamic they have is the most engaging aspect of the story as Maverick now struggles wit

author: MovieWarfare
text: This family dynamic they have is the most engaging aspect of the story as Maverick now struggles with the possibility of letting the son of his once best friend die. Nevertheless, I do have some minor nitpicks with the film. I do find the dynamic of the recruits never does quite match the dynamic of the recruits from the first film. I never felt as strong of an attachment to the recruits and this is probably due to the film focusing on the teacher Maverick. There is also a romantic subplot with Maverick and Penny that just feels very superfluous. It never felt like the romance part was even connected to anything in the main plot. Heck, you could take this romance subplot and Penny out of the film and the main story is still the same. It just felt like the romance plot just took away screen

author: MovieWarfare
text:
film and the main story is still the same. It just felt like the romance plot just took away screen time from the interesting stuff. I am also a little annoyed that there is no dialogue or line to explain why Maverick isn't with Charlie from the first film anymore. Especially, considering how relevant that character was in the first film.

Overall, Top Gun: Maverick is better than the first movie in almost every aspect. It has more amazing action sequences and a more interesting character-driven story. In a world where CGI seems to always be the go-to solution, we then get a rare movie like this where the majority is practical and it is all the better for it. This is not only a worthy sequel but also an amazing accomplishment in movies.

author: MovieWarfare

author: Kamiyou
text:
In the original Top Gun, Pete "Maverick" Mitchell wasn't perfect. In this movie, he is.

This movie relentlessly builds the character up into an infallible, extremely boring superhero, who gets second chances for anything and everything. The new generation of pilots that should surpass and replace a man past his physical prime isn't even allowed to come close to him. Also, nepotism is OK when it benefits Maverick, for some reason.

The original movie, so often dismissed as "dumb Reaganite bombast", had characters who were at least human. Interesting at times. Definitely not fit for real military service, but good for a story. Top Gun Maverick is much sillier and less believable than its forebear.

author: Rebecca31
text:
Alright folks, strap yourselves in for one of the most anticipated movies of the year, the Navy‚Äôs top aviators are finally back. After over thirty years, Pete Mitchell (Tom Cruise) has been called back into service. Join Cruise and all the other top pilots in their most dangerous mission yet, only this time without the cheesy 80s soundtrack. Maverick finds himself in the unlikely position as a teacher to the best of the best Top Gun graduates for a confidential and highly dangerous mission in ‚Äúinsert generic country here.‚Äù Not only is Maverick faced with the difficult task of training these pilots for a mission ‚Äúthe likes of which no living pilot has ever seen‚Äù but one of the recruits is Lt. Bradley Bradshaw (Miles Teller) aka ‚ÄúRooster‚Äù aka the son of ‚ÄúGoose‚Äù.

Well I know the original T

author: Rebecca31
text:
Bradley Bradshaw (Miles Teller) aka ‚ÄúRooster‚Äù aka the son of ‚ÄúGoose‚Äù.

Well I know the original Top Gun has a massive fanbase, who I can only imagine love it so much due to nostalgia because if like me you recently watched it, I think we all realise it has not aged well at all. Top Gun: Maverick has taken the franchise to a whole new level, very much like the Mission Impossible movies, it‚Äôs kicked it into a new gear and is all about the action. The flight sequences are an exhilarating thrill ride you won‚Äôt want to miss. Adrenaline fuelled, gripping and so well filmed that you will feel like you‚Äôre sitting in the jets themselves. Visually epic, and exceeds expectations. It‚Äôs not necessary to see the original Top Gun beforehand but it does help. And although Top Gun: Maverick isn‚Äôt as che

author: Rebecca31
text:
to see the original Top Gun beforehand but it does help. And although Top Gun: Maverick isn‚Äôt as cheesy as the first one, it does have enough cringey dialogue to remind you that you are in fact watching a Top Gun movie.

There‚Äôs also a surprising emotional element throughout that I definitely wasn‚Äôt expecting, and the decision to bring back Val Kilmer as Tom ‚ÄúIceman‚Äù Kazansky was handled perfectly. Miles Teller was absolutely perfect casting for Lt. Nick Bradshaw‚Äôs son. It‚Äôs been a while since I‚Äôve seen Teller in anything as good as Whiplash and he‚Äôs here now reminding us all of how good an actor he really is. Top Gun: Maverick has improved on the original in every way and caters towards both new and old fans of Top Gun.

I was ‚Äúlucky‚Äù enough to be sitting right next to three of Tom Cr

author: Rebecca31
text:
oth new and old fans of Top Gun.

I was ‚Äúlucky‚Äù enough to be sitting right next to three of Tom Cruise‚Äôs biggest fans. They might have been enjoying it more than everyone else in the cinema combined judging by their whooping, clapping and the fact that they were practically wetting themselves with anticipation any time Cruise was onscreen or there was any sort of reference made to the original Top Gun. These ultra-fanboys loved every minute of it so Top Gun fans I can promise you‚Äôll absolutely adore this sequel.

Look many of you know that I‚Äôm not the biggest Tom Cruise fan at all but when he‚Äôs delivering on the action it‚Äôs honestly a terrific experience to see on the big screen in a cinema. He may not be Hollywood‚Äôs greatest actor but he‚Äôs got one setting that he does better than anyo

author: Rebecca31
text: ema. He may not be Hollywood‚Äôs greatest actor but he‚Äôs got one setting that he does better than anyone, and that setting is action man. Despite being nearly sixty he does not shy away from the stunts and in a time where cinemas are struggling I can tell you that Top Gun: Maverick is made for the big screen so be sure you see it on the biggest screen possible and enjoy. Highly recommended and a must see for all the Top Gun fans.

author: Stream2BigScree
text:
Hey, Streamers, let's fly off into the Danger Zone. Yes, it's Top Gun: Maverick time. The sequel you have been waiting almost 40 years for, which was supposed to come out 2 years ago, is finally here. Now, I have never seen the original film, but I was keen to see what all the hype around this sequel was about. Tom Cruise has made good choices over the years and he's always going full tilt in these action roles, so I didn't expect for this to disappoint. Here's how it goes.

Even though Top Gun: Maverick is a present-day sequel to the original Top Gun (1986), the movie really leans into that old-fashioned, 1980's action film vibe. Also, there is a big spoiler from the original film that is central to the story of this sequel - Maverick's wingman, Goose, died. Here, Goose's son, Rooster (

author: Stream2BigScree
text:
central to the story of this sequel - Maverick's wingman, Goose, died. Here, Goose's son, Rooster (Miles Teller), is one of the elite Navy aviators, who Maverick (Tom Cruise) is tasked with training for what's considered an important but impossible mission. There is tension between Maverick and Rooster because of their fraught history. There is tension between Maverick and his superiors because he is notorious for going rogue. Nevertheless, Maverick is the best and the mission requires the best. High-flying hijnks ensue.

Top Gun: Maverick is the kind of movie that begs to be seen on a big screen. In my opinion, the story is not really great or innovative, so the actions sequences, stunts and camera work have to justify the price of admission. Luckily, they very much do. The aerial shot

author: Stream2BigScree
text:
and camera work have to justify the price of admission. Luckily, they very much do. The aerial shots and all of the fighter jets flying have to be seen on a big screen to truly be appreciated. The rumble of the jets and the perceived danger add to the tension that builds up through the movie and explodes in the final sequences. While there is an attempt to build an emotional core to the film by focusing on Maverick and Rooster's relationship and also a slight love interest on the side, those relationships barely register and seem almost superfluous. Honestly, they could've cut the love story and the film would have been the same but 10-15 minutes shorter - that would have given them the ability to cultivate the Maverick and Rooster relationship, which would have been more impactful.

So

author: Stream2BigScree
text:
lity to cultivate the Maverick and Rooster relationship, which would have been more impactful.

Some of this movie is so retro as to be kind of corny. Glen Powell plays Hangman. He's one of the **** aviators in the Top Gun program. Powell plays it like the quintessential 1980's movie villain, which was groan-inducing at times, but some may love it. Tom Cruise is at his Tom-Cruise-iest, which isn't a bad thing. Movies need stars and Tom Cruise is still a movie star. He still has the charm to pull off Maverick's character. As the movie leans into the nostalgia, Tom Cruise makes it worthy of being on a big screen. This movie desperately needs that.

Nevertheless, what was presented was certainly entertaining. There will be times when the flying will have you on the edge of your seat. That

author: Stream2BigScree
text:
ainly entertaining. There will be times when the flying will have you on the edge of your seat. That's why a movie like this is made. In that way, it is quite successful.

Ultimately, Top Gun: Maverick is tailor-made to be seen in a movie theater. The feats of stunts and action are worthy of the big screen. There are times when you may be on the edge of your seat. Although the story is a bit lacking, the rest of the movie makes up for it and the 2-hour runtime flies by in a *wink*. Grab a box of popcorn and enjoy this spectacle on a big screen.

author: Lumdog
text: This is a true action blockbuster that is so rare these days. The big messy CGI set pieces that are all too common today have desensitised and bored audiences to what real action can be. Audiences are screaming for action that is shot practically and real, visceral, and heart pumping. Top Gun: Maverick exceeds the first one in every way. This is how you make a perfect sequel - reinvigorating the franchise whilst injecting just enough nostalgia and cheesiness to pay homage to the original. Credit to Tom Cruise for making the film happen, and dedicating himself to performing these stunts practically. Super fun and an incredible watch!

author: Stercrazy
text: An excellent sequel to a classic. Full of the franchise's signature high octane scenes, the movie nevertheless manages to have many emotional and poignant scenes, especially between Maverick and Rooster. The movie also has an incredibly touching moment paying tribute to Val Kilmer that had everyone in the theater with me tearing up. I definitely recommend it.

author: Dee-Jay_Deli
text: This is good. Mostly thanks to the unique air-combat action that is thrilling to watch. Not to say the human drama doesn't do its job, but it clearly isn't the priority. The movie does build on the original's characters and events a little more than I expected. It's easy to gripe about too many side-characters and how a little more focus on the core characters and relationships would have given it more emotional punch, but that's only a minor issue. Overall, Top Gun Maverick is an absolutely thrilling experience, especially on a large screen and the movie (literally) takes off.

author: ValBal
text: Cruise control baby! I think this film is best described as the movie that was made in the 80s and I mean it in the best way possible. Apart from technology that was used to achieve beautiful shots of fighter planes action this film is a classic heroism tale. It's full of heart, badass moments, character drama and romance that's perhaps the only unnecessary part of the film.

author: Compi24
text: Honestly, the hype this had coming out of Cannes had me a bit worried. If even that film festival's occasionally-fussy audience members managed to bestow this with near-universal acclaim, then that's a lot of damn pressure on me to like this thing too. Christ alive did I nothing to worry about. Not only is "Top Gun: Maverick" at least a worthy companion piece to the seminal 80's classic, it's a disarmingly superior film and quite possibly one of the best sequels to a movie that's about as much of a cultural fixture as movies can get. Joseph Kosinski, Tom Cruise and the screenwriting and stunt teams needs to take a victory lap on this one. Potent emotionality, eminent likability on the part of Cruise and ripping soundtrack aside, the thing I loved the most about this one is how much the sta

author: Compi24
text: f Cruise and ripping soundtrack aside, the thing I loved the most about this one is how much the stakes and circumstances are ramped up this time around. I remember the set pieces in the original Tony Scott film being engaging and entertaining, but never quite as intense and menacing as they're presented here. There's almost a point in the film where you as an audience member are dreading the moment where this final mission has to take place. The action also scales in such a satisfying way throughout the course of the film, with the finale honestly constituting one of the best action sequences I've seen in a movie in a very, very long time. Doubtful that any summer movie's going to top this in the coming months. Completely floored with how much I absolutely loved nearly every minute of thi

author: Compi24
text: in the coming months. Completely floored with how much I absolutely loved nearly every minute of this.

author: azzamann79
text: I'm not sure what movie others were watching but this is not even close to bettering the original. It lacks the soul of the original. From the  one liners that people still remember today the cast of over the top egotistical characters who are larger than life. The great soundtrack that strikes up at the right time. This movie has none of it. It try's to ride on the coat tails of nostalgia and falls flat. It won't take your breath away. Infact if anything it's lost that loving feeling.

author: LuissDt
text: It's time to fly with Tom Cruise in Top Gun Maverick, an exciting sequel full of great joy, it seems that everything indicates that there is already a movie that flies to the OSCARS 2023.

author: SXTREME
text: Excellent movie overall, great story, great acting. It is the first time we see actors flying those amazing machines and it is certainly an amazing experience.

author: JLuis_001
text:
Many times the entertainment that doesn't seek to be complicated tends to be very relaxed and ends up being rather poor and, of course, completely forgettable.
Top Gun: Maverick falls into the category of pure entertainment, but it's one that makes the case of how to do it the right way. The story may seem simple yes, I'll give you that, but its strength is the action sequences and the film doesn't lie about it and gives it to you in abundance. Everything that happens with jets in this film is spectacular, especially that beautiful opening sequence with Maverick piloting that hypersonic plane. Does it rely on nostalgia? Of course, especially with that little Val Kilmer appearance, but it never feels like a gratuitous resource within the story. After all the movie makes it clear that it's

author: JLuis_001
text:
ver feels like a gratuitous resource within the story. After all the movie makes it clear that it's a sequel, but it's not 100% vital for you to have seen the original.
And even if you can question how necessary this sequel was after 36 years, this story proves its functionality in the blockbuster branch that should continue to invest in films like this one. Yes, it's a sequel and stars an ultra-famous name, but there's life for blockbusters outside of superheroes.
Of course, that remains to be seen at the box office, after all, even with inflation, the original film cost just over $30 million, Top Gun: Maverick, not counting marketing, cost over $150 million.

It sounds repetitive and perhaps for people who prefer streaming they won't even flinch, but as Cruise said it and as he fough

author: JLuis_001
text: erhaps for people who prefer streaming they won't even flinch, but as Cruise said it and as he fought for it, films like these are the ones that remind us why the theatrical experience will never be matched. Go see it, and have a good time.

author: costant99
text:
FANTASTICOOOOOOO, Miglior film dell'anno

Tom Cruise √® lui la CGI, cast favoloso e regia da oscar!!!

Consigliato!!!

author: Markini
text: Top Gun: Maverick is as good if not better than the original movie from the 80s. The first and third acts keep in glued to the screen in anticipation to what will happen next. The nostalgia music sounds just as good 30 years later. All actors from Tom Cruise to the younger crew do an exceptional job in their acting. The real jet fighter scenes really encapsulate the jaw dropping moments during several parts in the film. The revamped volleyball scene does not disappoint either. And the film ending with Gaga's epic ballad really seals the deal.

author: bertobellamy
text: If 'Top Gun' is about Maverick coming into terms with his sexuality ‚Äî as Tarantino explained in that hilarious video ‚Äî then 'Top Gun Maverick' is about Tom Cruise saving the cinematic experience. When Ed Harris' character tells Maverick that "his kind it's headed for extinction", Maverick's "But not today, sir" is Tom Cruise's war declaration to streaming services. As long as he's alive, no film of his will debut on any platform. Even if you hate the guy, you gotta praise his commitment to the good old habit of going to the cinema.

author: royalguy07
text: I can NOT believe we got a shirtless and sweaty full on Tom Cruise running moment. And the movie pulled it off semi unironically.

author: Lfellipeneres
text: Best movie of the year, great to see this in 2022, Tom Cruise show to us the

author: Fortysixter_UK
text: This movie was impeccably filmed, had great music, awesome sound and an engaging story. It didn't seem to have a slow moment in it.  The military hardware was great to see in motion and everything just "felt" right with a lot of throwbacks to the earlier film as well as this one forging its own path.  Fun, poignant and great action. A review score seems almost arbitrary as I'll buy this on 4 k when released. So if you liked the first Top Gun you'll like this one.  9.9/10. Go see it then go and buy it on your favourite format when it's released. 25/5/2022.

author: KodiakB
text: I had absolutely 0 expectations coming to this movie - I didn‚Äôt really know what it is going to be about and neither did I see the previous movie. Nevertheless, I was absolutely stunned by an amalgamation of visual, auditory and 4D experience of the movie, it really drove my adrenaline up. But what was more surprising is how human the movie is - it conveys emotions, hopes, ups and downs so good that it‚Äôs not possible not to care about every single character in the movie. Moreover, even though I didn‚Äôt see the first movie, I still got a great sense of nostalgia that is done just right to bring context to the movie, not just cash on peoples memories. All in all, I‚Äôm just mesmerized by it and might go for the 2nd run.

author: Yokoharu
text: Fantastic movie that takes everything good from the first one and improves on it. I can't fault it.

author: BradMorgan
text: Top Gun: Maverick is one of the most gripping action movies I've ever seen. Moments that you are literally on the edge of your seat don't happen often anymore. Yet this film manages to amaze in 2022 with breathtaking shots in which you almost feel the g-forces, a fantastic soundtrack and a story that has taken the time to tell it at the right pace. This film is one to remember!

author: Royzen
text: It's probably the best movie this year,  better than the first top gun in every point

author: joyal
text:
Outstanding .If you didn't see the first part, see it first before experiencing this one ,this part just does what a sequel should do - which in this case means Doubling down on the Incredible Visuals ,Thrills and Emotions that made the topgun so much Fun!

And you just can watch it for one man the maverick himself TomCruise ,he is keep finding ways to entertain to the highest level and this role he just done it with heartwarming emotions !

Excellent making and directions and background score is perfect to the story pacing and all cast done terrific job !!

author: 43in2014
text:
The short review: This has the best jet fighter action scenes in a film, EVER. The human drama part, however, falls a bit short. Related media: I have seen the original Top Gun film on TV numerous times. That film likely had the best jet fighter action scenes in a film back then too, and the human drama part also fell a bit short back then too.


Positives:


1) All the jet fighter scenes are genuinely, top of the class! 2) The sound effects and the special effects are really top notch!


3) The excuse used to feature the F-14 fighter in the film in a major way, when no F-14 is allowed to fly anymore, in the military or by the public, is CLEVER.


Negatives: 1) (This is hinted at in the trailer, so it‚Äôs not spoiler.) It has been some 35 years since the events in the original fi

author: 43in2014
text:
in the trailer, so it‚Äôs not spoiler.) It has been some 35 years since the events in the original film. Surely the grief over the death of Goose should be over by now? This part is rather unrealistic. I know there‚Äôs more to it, but still‚Ä¶


2) The past relationship between Maverick and new flame was hinted at, but not covered much in this film. This coincided with a slow part of the film, thus making this part feel poor.


3) The original film had two great original songs. The songs in this film are not great.



4) (This is hinted at in the trailer, so it‚Äôs not a spoiler.) The top enemy fighter plane is obviously the Russian Su-57 (Felon), yet the film makes all attempts to call it the ‚Äòfifth generation fighter‚Äô rather than its real name, all the time, such that the film distrib

author: 43in2014
text:
t the ‚Äòfifth generation fighter‚Äô rather than its real name, all the time, such that the film distributor can sell the film to the Russian market. That‚Äôs silly! Considering the banning of such sales following the Russo-Ukrainian war, that‚Äôs all for nought! Pilots would not use so many words to describe the fighter. As with the original Top Gun film, where the enemy fighter was given the fictitious name, Mig-28, here the fighter should also had been given a fictitious name, like ‚ÄòFirefox‚Äô.


Children: Excellent.


Teens: Excellent.


Young adults: Excellent.


Medium-age adults: Excellent


Older adults: Good.                    My rating: 4/5 (no half scores). Definitely watch it in the cinema.

author: 43in2014
text: it in the cinema.

author: David F
text: I guess I can‚Äôt understand why so many people loved this movie.  There was some excellent cinematography, but the plot seemed very predictable, and I felt like I had seen this type of movie so many times before. It certainly had some cool moments, but also had some cringey over the top emotional scenes.  It all just felt pretty basic to me.

author: Michael S.
text: ‚ÄúTop Gun Maverick‚Äù is a very overrated film. Some of the plane scenes were cool, but the whole entire mission didn‚Äôt make sense due to several factors. The movie focuses on a daring, low-altitude attack against a heavily defended uranium enrichment plant, which experts and veterans point out would likely be handled with different tactics in reality. This movie is very overlooked,because of the nostalgia people feel from watching the first one. The high action plane scenes were another reason this film was overlooked.

author: Lore O
text: Absolutely horrific that this is so popular. The entire movie is just a rip-off of the Death Star trench run from Star Wars. Other than that it's just a rehash of the original. It's completely pathetic. Tom Cruise doesn't deserve a career. 1 Star solely for Miles Teller and Glen Powell. Feel bad for anyone that has to work with that hack.

author: Christopher Z
text:
I cannot honestly believe this movie was loved by so many. I'm not some contrarian, I absolutely love movies both serious cinema and B movies.
But Top Gun: Maverick was so incredibly stupid. It was literally the first movie redone the exact same way with an even more moronic plot than the original. You need to fly low in order to destroy some facility? That's utter nonsense. And then the behind enemy lines stealing of a jet? What is this an Owen Wilson movie? Seriously this movie was so bad I was laughing at how idiotic it was.

author: James N
text: The flight scenes are incredible, as expected. The movie, as a whole, is garbage. The casting, the story line, the sets..... just bad. It's like "Bring It On" meets "Fast and Furious". The original Top Gun was filmed on navy bases, in real bars, in real barracks, etc. This is a hodge podge of bad sets, CGI back grounds, and ridiculous hollywood movie tricks. Bummer.

author: Jared C
text: Predictable hero's journey drivel. So many cliche's it was hard to keep track of. The admittedly entertaining and dramatic flight scenes are ruined by the fact that the climactic mission through a trench at high speed to hit an impossibly small target is practically a frame by frame rip off of Star Wars Episode iV. There may never have been a film less deserving of the praise it has received.

text: i cannot deny that this is a technically impressive film. at the same time, i dont know how they managed to make fighter jet combat so boring.

author: Jimmy R
text:
It has a 99% score cause of all the fan boys and girls :D Its an okay action movie if you dont expect anything. Its so, SO! predictable. If you think it cant check all the clishees - trust me it will. F.e.: Very first scene: "you go 10 Mach, not 10.2, not 10.1" and of course he will go over the mark.
And very american patriotic. Doesn¬¥t matter who dies as long as its no person from the US :D
It passes the time but not a 99% movie at all.

author: Iain D
text:
Genuinely awful compared to the original. I don't know why people liked it so much. It was the disappointment of a lifetime. 
The original had a great storyline, it was believable, the characters were believable, the action scenes weren't overly falsified apart from the inverted scene with a MiG/F-5.
Nothing about this film is believable. CGI-tastic. Apparently the creme de la creme of the US Navy aviators are just out of nappies. Maverick flies a Mach 9-doesn't exist-looks ridiculous-nicked it without authorisation plane and ejects landing in a pub.... WTAF?!
The storyline is woeful and the acting is dreadful. 
As a huge fan of the original this is honestly one of the worst films I've ever seen. Sorry.

text: i cannot deny that this is a technically impressive film. at the same time, i dont know how they managed to make fighter jet combat so boring.

author: Jimmy R
text:
It has a 99% score cause of all the fan boys and girls :D Its an okay action movie if you dont expect anything. Its so, SO! predictable. If you think it cant check all the clishees - trust me it will. F.e.: Very first scene: "you go 10 Mach, not 10.2, not 10.1" and of course he will go over the mark.
And very american patriotic. Doesn¬¥t matter who dies as long as its no person from the US :D
It passes the time but not a 99% movie at all.

author: Iain D
text:
Genuinely awful compared to the original. I don't know why people liked it so much. It was the disappointment of a lifetime. 
The original had a great storyline, it was believable, the characters were believable, the action scenes weren't overly falsified apart from the inverted scene with a MiG/F-5.
Nothing about this film is believable. CGI-tastic. Apparently the creme de la creme of the US Navy aviators are just out of nappies. Maverick flies a Mach 9-doesn't exist-looks ridiculous-nicked it without authorisation plane and ejects landing in a pub.... WTAF?!
The storyline is woeful and the acting is dreadful. 
As a huge fan of the original this is honestly one of the worst films I've ever seen. Sorry.

author: T Scott B
text: What a piece of crap. Nothing believable in this movie, complete horseshit.

author: Miles  O
text: I mean it was alright, I found it quite cheesy with most characters having little depth or actual personality about them. I feel like it was mostly about ticking boxes rather than trying to make a good movie.

author: David F
text: I guess I can‚Äôt understand why so many people loved this movie.  There was some excellent cinematography, but the plot seemed very predictable, and I felt like I had seen this type of movie so many times before. It certainly had some cool moments, but also had some cringey over the top emotional scenes.  It all just felt pretty basic to me.

author: Michael S.
text: ‚ÄúTop Gun Maverick‚Äù is a very overrated film. Some of the plane scenes were cool, but the whole entire mission didn‚Äôt make sense due to several factors. The movie focuses on a daring, low-altitude attack against a heavily defended uranium enrichment plant, which experts and veterans point out would likely be handled with different tactics in reality. This movie is very overlooked,because of the nostalgia people feel from watching the first one. The high action plane scenes were another reason this film was overlooked.

author: Lore O
text: Absolutely horrific that this is so popular. The entire movie is just a rip-off of the Death Star trench run from Star Wars. Other than that it's just a rehash of the original. It's completely pathetic. Tom Cruise doesn't deserve a career. 1 Star solely for Miles Teller and Glen Powell. Feel bad for anyone that has to work with that hack.

author: Christopher Z
text:
I cannot honestly believe this movie was loved by so many. I'm not some contrarian, I absolutely love movies both serious cinema and B movies.
But Top Gun: Maverick was so incredibly stupid. It was literally the first movie redone the exact same way with an even more moronic plot than the original. You need to fly low in order to destroy some facility? That's utter nonsense. And then the behind enemy lines stealing of a jet? What is this an Owen Wilson movie? Seriously this movie was so bad I was laughing at how idiotic it was.

author: James N
text: The flight scenes are incredible, as expected. The movie, as a whole, is garbage. The casting, the story line, the sets..... just bad. It's like "Bring It On" meets "Fast and Furious". The original Top Gun was filmed on navy bases, in real bars, in real barracks, etc. This is a hodge podge of bad sets, CGI back grounds, and ridiculous hollywood movie tricks. Bummer.

author: Jared C
text: Predictable hero's journey drivel. So many cliche's it was hard to keep track of. The admittedly entertaining and dramatic flight scenes are ruined by the fact that the climactic mission through a trench at high speed to hit an impossibly small target is practically a frame by frame rip off of Star Wars Episode iV. There may never have been a film less deserving of the praise it has received.

Basically Tom Cruise staring off into the distance and tensing his jawline on loop

author: prawnda s
text: i cannot deny that this is a technically impressive film. at the same time, i dont know how they managed to make fighter jet combat so boring.

author: Jimmy R
text:
It has a 99% score cause of all the fan boys and girls :D Its an okay action movie if you dont expect anything. Its so, SO! predictable. If you think it cant check all the clishees - trust me it will. F.e.: Very first scene: "you go 10 Mach, not 10.2, not 10.1" and of course he will go over the mark.
And very american patriotic. Doesn¬¥t matter who dies as long as its no person from the US :D
It passes the time but not a 99% movie at all.

author: Iain D
text:
Genuinely awful compared to the original. I don't know why people liked it so much. It was the disappointment of a lifetime. 
The original had a great storyline, it was believable, the characters were believable, the action scenes weren't overly falsified apart from the inverted scene with a MiG/F-5.
Nothing about this film is believable. CGI-tastic. Apparently the creme de la creme of the US Navy aviators are just out of nappies. Maverick flies a Mach 9-doesn't exist-looks ridiculous-nicked it without authorisation plane and ejects landing in a pub.... WTAF?!
The storyline is woeful and the acting is dreadful. 
As a huge fan of the original this is honestly one of the worst films I've ever seen. Sorry.

author: T Scott B
text: What a piece of crap. Nothing believable in this movie, complete horseshit.

author: Miles  O
text: I mean it was alright, I found it quite cheesy with most characters having little depth or actual personality about them. I feel like it was mostly about ticking boxes rather than trying to make a good movie.

author: Paul M
text:
I don't get the love for this one. Silly and cringe-worthy story (even after a 2nd viewing). Too sentimental, made worse by Zimmer's soulless score that keeps droning on. The story arc is a heck of a lot flatter than the bombing mission being flown, lackluster acting, obvious vfx scenes that don't match the real plane action, etc etc.

An unworthy successor to the great 80s Top Gun.

author: Gregory T
text: Absolutely terrible movie. I walked out after 10 minutes. Last time I did that was with Mama Mia.

author: R D
text: What a roller coaster of a ride!! And just like a roller coaster its good for about 2 minutes, then your off to find something else to do.  How this made the top 10 of the top 300 of all time is way beyond belief.  Im guessing dollars push it there.  Money not well spent.

author: Sam P
text:
A total snooze fest. Annoying, unlikeable characters retread the tedious footsteps of the annoying, unlikeable but at least vaguely iconic characters of the first movie. Visually dull, politically revolting and structured like a bowl of milkless porridge.

The high scores are because people saw a man on the screen whooping with delight, and like the apes they are they felt compelled to do the same.

author: Suicide N
text: I have never checked a movie 6 times to see how much longer the torture world continue.  Not memorable at all and quite boring.

author: Ralph W
text: Awful. Wafer thin plot completely unbelievable. A couple of hours of my life I'll never get back.

author: Rosana B
text: Assisti com nojinho e desprezo, toda admira√ß√£o pela beleza e talento de Tom Cruise d√£o lugar a perplexidade a cada dia de um novo 'esc√¢ndalo', desculpe me, mas n√£o consigo separar o pessoal do profissional quando se trata de abandono parental, menos encantada ao descobrir o que uma religi√£o (Cientologia?!?!) pode ser t√£o destrutiva ao ponto de separa um pai de sua filha, e os filhos de uma m√£e, triste‚Ä¶ Filme chatinho, conforme minha enorme m√° vontade para com ele..

author: unknown
text: Not enough world building in my opinion

author: David F
text: I guess I can‚Äôt understand why so many people loved this movie.  There was some excellent cinematography, but the plot seemed very predictable, and I felt like I had seen this type of movie so many times before. It certainly had some cool moments, but also had some cringey over the top emotional scenes.  It all just felt pretty basic to me.

author: Michael S.
text: ‚ÄúTop Gun Maverick‚Äù is a very overrated film. Some of the plane scenes were cool, but the whole entire mission didn‚Äôt make sense due to several factors. The movie focuses on a daring, low-altitude attack against a heavily defended uranium enrichment plant, which experts and veterans point out would likely be handled with different tactics in reality. This movie is very overlooked,because of the nostalgia people feel from watching the first one. The high action plane scenes were another reason this film was overlooked.

author: Lore O
text: Absolutely horrific that this is so popular. The entire movie is just a rip-off of the Death Star trench run from Star Wars. Other than that it's just a rehash of the original. It's completely pathetic. Tom Cruise doesn't deserve a career. 1 Star solely for Miles Teller and Glen Powell. Feel bad for anyone that has to work with that hack.

author: Christopher Z
text:
I cannot honestly believe this movie was loved by so many. I'm not some contrarian, I absolutely love movies both serious cinema and B movies.
But Top Gun: Maverick was so incredibly stupid. It was literally the first movie redone the exact same way with an even more moronic plot than the original. You need to fly low in order to destroy some facility? That's utter nonsense. And then the behind enemy lines stealing of a jet? What is this an Owen Wilson movie? Seriously this movie was so bad I was laughing at how idiotic it was.

author: James N
text: The flight scenes are incredible, as expected. The movie, as a whole, is garbage. The casting, the story line, the sets..... just bad. It's like "Bring It On" meets "Fast and Furious". The original Top Gun was filmed on navy bases, in real bars, in real barracks, etc. This is a hodge podge of bad sets, CGI back grounds, and ridiculous hollywood movie tricks. Bummer.

author: Jared C
text: Predictable hero's journey drivel. So many cliche's it was hard to keep track of. The admittedly entertaining and dramatic flight scenes are ruined by the fact that the climactic mission through a trench at high speed to hit an impossibly small target is practically a frame by frame rip off of Star Wars Episode iV. There may never have been a film less deserving of the praise it has received.

author: STEPHEN P
text: Of course way over hyped and way over done. Relying on so much "action" and special effects just is a substitute for better writing and character development - this whole thing is Alpha male, never loses, no matter what even crazy odds against it. Surprise - very predictable.

It has a 99% score cause of all the fan boys and girls :D Its an okay action movie if you dont expect anything. Its so, SO! predictable. If you think it cant check all the clishees - trust me it will. F.e.: Very first scene: "you go 10 Mach, not 10.2, not 10.1" and of course he will go over the mark.
And very american patriotic. Doesn¬¥t matter who dies as long as its no person from the US :D
It passes the time but not a 99% movie at all.

author: Iain D
text:
Genuinely awful compared to the original. I don't know why people liked it so much. It was the disappointment of a lifetime. 
The original had a great storyline, it was believable, the characters were believable, the action scenes weren't overly falsified apart from the inverted scene with a MiG/F-5.
Nothing about this film is believable. CGI-tastic. Apparently the creme de la creme of the US Navy aviators are just out of nappies. Maverick flies a Mach 9-doesn't exist-looks ridiculous-nicked it without authorisation plane and ejects landing in a pub.... WTAF?!
The storyline is woeful and the acting is dreadful. 
As a huge fan of the original this is honestly one of the worst films I've ever seen. Sorry.

author: T Scott B
text: What a piece of crap. Nothing believable in this movie, complete horseshit.

author: Miles  O
text: I mean it was alright, I found it quite cheesy with most characters having little depth or actual personality about them. I feel like it was mostly about ticking boxes rather than trying to make a good movie.

author: Paul M
text:
I don't get the love for this one. Silly and cringe-worthy story (even after a 2nd viewing). Too sentimental, made worse by Zimmer's soulless score that keeps droning on. The story arc is a heck of a lot flatter than the bombing mission being flown, lackluster acting, obvious vfx scenes that don't match the real plane action, etc etc.

An unworthy successor to the great 80s Top Gun.

author: Gregory T
text: Absolutely terrible movie. I walked out after 10 minutes. Last time I did that was with Mama Mia.

author: R D
text: What a roller coaster of a ride!! And just like a roller coaster its good for about 2 minutes, then your off to find something else to do.  How this made the top 10 of the top 300 of all time is way beyond belief.  Im guessing dollars push it there.  Money not well spent.

author: Sam P
text:
A total snooze fest. Annoying, unlikeable characters retread the tedious footsteps of the annoying, unlikeable but at least vaguely iconic characters of the first movie. Visually dull, politically revolting and structured like a bowl of milkless porridge.

The high scores are because people saw a man on the screen whooping with delight, and like the apes they are they felt compelled to do the same.

author: Suicide N
text: I have never checked a movie 6 times to see how much longer the torture world continue.  Not memorable at all and quite boring.

author: Ralph W
text: Awful. Wafer thin plot completely unbelievable. A couple of hours of my life I'll never get back.

author: Rosana B
text: Assisti com nojinho e desprezo, toda admira√ß√£o pela beleza e talento de Tom Cruise d√£o lugar a perplexidade a cada dia de um novo 'esc√¢ndalo', desculpe me, mas n√£o consigo separar o pessoal do profissional quando se trata de abandono parental, menos encantada ao descobrir o que uma religi√£o (Cientologia?!?!) pode ser t√£o destrutiva ao ponto de separa um pai de sua filha, e os filhos de uma m√£e, triste‚Ä¶ Filme chatinho, conforme minha enorme m√° vontade para com ele..

author: unknown
text: Not enough world building in my opinion

author: OSCAR P
text: I worked with these A/C on the flightline back in the day. This movie portrays NOTHING in reality.

author: Crom M
text:
Did ai write this movie? 
I loved the original, but this movie is awful.

author: unknown
text: This movie was terrible üëé it was clich√©, predictable and LAME. Do not watch this movie if you wanna be bored out of your everloving mindüôÑ

author: Jon R
text: Parachuting out of jet going Mach 100 and then knocking on someone‚Äôs door?  This movie is the worst. If I could have given less than a half star I would have.

author: R Z
text: It insists upon itself.

author: David B
text: Did not like the first top gun,and top gun 2 is just as bad very over the top American bullshit,bar scenes embarrassing to watch,tom cruise is good,but sorry it was same story as before,glad I did not pay to see this

author: Bas L
text: basically advertising for military

author: Huw J
text: Just watched some of thus on TV, Nd turned over after an hour...... it's so boring and clich√© ridden.

author: unknown
text: It's one of the corniest movies ever made. Honestly a waste of time.

author: John R
text: This was the most ridiculous and over rated movie of all time. The entire plot line is pathetic and Miles Teller finished off the movie with his terrible acting.

author: David F
text: I guess I can‚Äôt understand why so many people loved this movie.  There was some excellent cinematography, but the plot seemed very predictable, and I felt like I had seen this type of movie so many times before. It certainly had some cool moments, but also had some cringey over the top emotional scenes.  It all just felt pretty basic to me.

author: Michael S.
text: ‚ÄúTop Gun Maverick‚Äù is a very overrated film. Some of the plane scenes were cool, but the whole entire mission didn‚Äôt make sense due to several factors. The movie focuses on a daring, low-altitude attack against a heavily defended uranium enrichment plant, which experts and veterans point out would likely be handled with different tactics in reality. This movie is very overlooked,because of the nostalgia people feel from watching the first one. The high action plane scenes were another reason this film was overlooked.

author: Lore O
text: Absolutely horrific that this is so popular. The entire movie is just a rip-off of the Death Star trench run from Star Wars. Other than that it's just a rehash of the original. It's completely pathetic. Tom Cruise doesn't deserve a career. 1 Star solely for Miles Teller and Glen Powell. Feel bad for anyone that has to work with that hack.

author: Christopher Z
text:
I cannot honestly believe this movie was loved by so many. I'm not some contrarian, I absolutely love movies both serious cinema and B movies.
But Top Gun: Maverick was so incredibly stupid. It was literally the first movie redone the exact same way with an even more moronic plot than the original. You need to fly low in order to destroy some facility? That's utter nonsense. And then the behind enemy lines stealing of a jet? What is this an Owen Wilson movie? Seriously this movie was so bad I was laughing at how idiotic it was.

author: James N
text: The flight scenes are incredible, as expected. The movie, as a whole, is garbage. The casting, the story line, the sets..... just bad. It's like "Bring It On" meets "Fast and Furious". The original Top Gun was filmed on navy bases, in real bars, in real barracks, etc. This is a hodge podge of bad sets, CGI back grounds, and ridiculous hollywood movie tricks. Bummer.

author: Jared C
text: Predictable hero's journey drivel. So many cliche's it was hard to keep track of. The admittedly entertaining and dramatic flight scenes are ruined by the fact that the climactic mission through a trench at high speed to hit an impossibly small target is practically a frame by frame rip off of Star Wars Episode iV. There may never have been a film less deserving of the praise it has received.

author: STEPHEN P
text: Of course way over hyped and way over done. Relying on so much "action" and special effects just is a substitute for better writing and character development - this whole thing is Alpha male, never loses, no matter what even crazy odds against it. Surprise - very predictable.

author: Eiren W
text:
A film that shows happens when you chuck money at a film, without talent or reason. Fine if you‚Äôre bored mid week, but does not earn the rating it has at all. So many more captivating and brilliant films out there that have scores less than this. 
Basically Tom Cruise staring off into the distance and tensing his jawline on loop

text: i cannot deny that this is a technically impressive film. at the same time, i dont know how they managed to make fighter jet combat so boring.

author: David B
text: Did not like the first top gun,and top gun 2 is just as bad very over the top American bullshit,bar scenes embarrassing to watch,tom cruise is good,but sorry it was same story as before,glad I did not pay to see this

author: Bas L
text: basically advertising for military

author: Huw J
text: Just watched some of thus on TV, Nd turned over after an hour...... it's so boring and clich√© ridden.

author: unknown
text: It's one of the corniest movies ever made. Honestly a waste of time.

author: John R
text: This was the most ridiculous and over rated movie of all time. The entire plot line is pathetic and Miles Teller finished off the movie with his terrible acting.

author: Matthew K
text: Is this a remake? Or a "new" movie? Come on, here.

author: laughoy4
text: Horrible story telling, completely fake action, horrendous development. How people found this good was terrifying about movie consumers. Nothing was explained and everything was full of plot holes. Terrible film

author: mike f
text: Yet another example of self glorifying American Exceptionalism.  When another country (besides US) aquires WMDs our military decides to unilaterally defy international law.  For the only country that has used nukes to act so morally superior is the height of hypocrisy, and this silly little flick perpetuates the lies.

author: Christopher H
text: Stupid, one-dimensional drivel, chok full of clich√©s. TV movie quality acting, at best.

author: Qumars R
text: Penny got a car, devastated

author: Peter V
text: Silly and predictable - hero survives, is lauded and gets the girl. Supporting cast is  weak and action takes are not credible. Escapists - enjoy! :)

author: David F
text: I guess I can‚Äôt understand why so many people loved this movie.  There was some excellent cinematography, but the plot seemed very predictable, and I felt like I had seen this type of movie so many times before. It certainly had some cool moments, but also had some cringey over the top emotional scenes.  It all just felt pretty basic to me.

author: Michael S.
text: ‚ÄúTop Gun Maverick‚Äù is a very overrated film. Some of the plane scenes were cool, but the whole entire mission didn‚Äôt make sense due to several factors. The movie focuses on a daring, low-altitude attack against a heavily defended uranium enrichment plant, which experts and veterans point out would likely be handled with different tactics in reality. This movie is very overlooked,because of the nostalgia people feel from watching the first one. The high action plane scenes were another reason this film was overlooked.

author: Lore O
text: Absolutely horrific that this is so popular. The entire movie is just a rip-off of the Death Star trench run from Star Wars. Other than that it's just a rehash of the original. It's completely pathetic. Tom Cruise doesn't deserve a career. 1 Star solely for Miles Teller and Glen Powell. Feel bad for anyone that has to work with that hack.

author: Christopher Z
text:
I cannot honestly believe this movie was loved by so many. I'm not some contrarian, I absolutely love movies both serious cinema and B movies.
But Top Gun: Maverick was so incredibly stupid. It was literally the first movie redone the exact same way with an even more moronic plot than the original. You need to fly low in order to destroy some facility? That's utter nonsense. And then the behind enemy lines stealing of a jet? What is this an Owen Wilson movie? Seriously this movie was so bad I was laughing at how idiotic it was.

author: James N
text: The flight scenes are incredible, as expected. The movie, as a whole, is garbage. The casting, the story line, the sets..... just bad. It's like "Bring It On" meets "Fast and Furious". The original Top Gun was filmed on navy bases, in real bars, in real barracks, etc. This is a hodge podge of bad sets, CGI back grounds, and ridiculous hollywood movie tricks. Bummer.

author: Jared C
text: Predictable hero's journey drivel. So many cliche's it was hard to keep track of. The admittedly entertaining and dramatic flight scenes are ruined by the fact that the climactic mission through a trench at high speed to hit an impossibly small target is practically a frame by frame rip off of Star Wars Episode iV. There may never have been a film less deserving of the praise it has received.

author: STEPHEN P
text: Of course way over hyped and way over done. Relying on so much "action" and special effects just is a substitute for better writing and character development - this whole thing is Alpha male, never loses, no matter what even crazy odds against it. Surprise - very predictable.

author: Eiren W
text:
A film that shows happens when you chuck money at a film, without talent or reason. Fine if you‚Äôre bored mid week, but does not earn the rating it has at all. So many more captivating and brilliant films out there that have scores less than this. 
Basically Tom Cruise staring off into the distance and tensing his jawline on loop

author: prawnda s
text: i cannot deny that this is a technically impressive film. at the same time, i dont know how they managed to make fighter jet combat so boring.

author: Jimmy R
text:
It has a 99% score cause of all the fan boys and girls :D Its an okay action movie if you dont expect anything. Its so, SO! predictable. If you think it cant check all the clishees - trust me it will. F.e.: Very first scene: "you go 10 Mach, not 10.2, not 10.1" and of course he will go over the mark.
And very american patriotic. Doesn¬¥t matter who dies as long as its no person from the US :D
It passes the time but not a 99% movie at all.

author: Iain D
text:
Genuinely awful compared to the original. I don't know why people liked it so much. It was the disappointment of a lifetime. 
The original had a great storyline, it was believable, the characters were believable, the action scenes weren't overly falsified apart from the inverted scene with a MiG/F-5.
Nothing about this film is believable. CGI-tastic. Apparently the creme de la creme of the US Navy aviators are just out of nappies. Maverick flies a Mach 9-doesn't exist-looks ridiculous-nicked it without authorisation plane and ejects landing in a pub.... WTAF?!
The storyline is woeful and the acting is dreadful. 
As a huge fan of the original this is honestly one of the worst films I've ever seen. Sorry.

author: T Scott B
text: What a piece of crap. Nothing believable in this movie, complete horseshit.

author: Miles  O
text: I mean it was alright, I found it quite cheesy with most characters having little depth or actual personality about them. I feel like it was mostly about ticking boxes rather than trying to make a good movie.

author: Paul M
text:
I don't get the love for this one. Silly and cringe-worthy story (even after a 2nd viewing). Too sentimental, made worse by Zimmer's soulless score that keeps droning on. The story arc is a heck of a lot flatter than the bombing mission being flown, lackluster acting, obvious vfx scenes that don't match the real plane action, etc etc.

An unworthy successor to the great 80s Top Gun.

author: Gregory T
text: Absolutely terrible movie. I walked out after 10 minutes. Last time I did that was with Mama Mia.

author: R D
text: What a roller coaster of a ride!! And just like a roller coaster its good for about 2 minutes, then your off to find something else to do.  How this made the top 10 of the top 300 of all time is way beyond belief.  Im guessing dollars push it there.  Money not well spent.

author: Sam P
text:
A total snooze fest. Annoying, unlikeable characters retread the tedious footsteps of the annoying, unlikeable but at least vaguely iconic characters of the first movie. Visually dull, politically revolting and structured like a bowl of milkless porridge.

The high scores are because people saw a man on the screen whooping with delight, and like the apes they are they felt compelled to do the same.

author: Suicide N
text: I have never checked a movie 6 times to see how much longer the torture world continue.  Not memorable at all and quite boring.

author: Ralph W
text: Awful. Wafer thin plot completely unbelievable. A couple of hours of my life I'll never get back.

author: Rosana B
text: Assisti com nojinho e desprezo, toda admira√ß√£o pela beleza e talento de Tom Cruise d√£o lugar a perplexidade a cada dia de um novo 'esc√¢ndalo', desculpe me, mas n√£o consigo separar o pessoal do profissional quando se trata de abandono parental, menos encantada ao descobrir o que uma religi√£o (Cientologia?!?!) pode ser t√£o destrutiva ao ponto de separa um pai de sua filha, e os filhos de uma m√£e, triste‚Ä¶ Filme chatinho, conforme minha enorme m√° vontade para com ele..

text: Not enough world building in my opinion

text: I worked with these A/C on the flightline back in the day. This movie portrays NOTHING in reality.

text:

I loved the original, but this movie is awful.

I'd recommend it as a watch just because I'm a cinefile and will watch almost anything once. But I wish Tom Cruise and other Hollywood folks would stop making dumb movies like this.

author: Steve D
text: Fans of the first will find a lot to like but it covers nothing new.

author: CJ S
text: Just no. Couldn't get through the first 20 minutes. Boring. Bad acting.

author: Daniela P
text: I've seen this movie countless times in the form of the typical brainwashing Hollywood cliches, but I have to admit that the ending was so dumb, that for a moment I thought that it turns the movie to some kind of a parody of these cliches. The critics' evaluation of 96% is beyond my understanding, I wouldn't give more than 10% to this total waste of time.

author: Sarah A
text: Another Tom Cruise ego movie. Not impressed with his performance and the story line was predictable. It was nice to see Iceman.

author: David F
text: I guess I can‚Äôt understand why so many people loved this movie.  There was some excellent cinematography, but the plot seemed very predictable, and I felt like I had seen this type of movie so many times before. It certainly had some cool moments, but also had some cringey over the top emotional scenes.  It all just felt pretty basic to me.

author: Michael S.
text: ‚ÄúTop Gun Maverick‚Äù is a very overrated film. Some of the plane scenes were cool, but the whole entire mission didn‚Äôt make sense due to several factors. The movie focuses on a daring, low-altitude attack against a heavily defended uranium enrichment plant, which experts and veterans point out would likely be handled with different tactics in reality. This movie is very overlooked,because of the nostalgia people feel from watching the first one. The high action plane scenes were another reason this film was overlooked.

author: Lore O
text: Absolutely horrific that this is so popular. The entire movie is just a rip-off of the Death Star trench run from Star Wars. Other than that it's just a rehash of the original. It's completely pathetic. Tom Cruise doesn't deserve a career. 1 Star solely for Miles Teller and Glen Powell. Feel bad for anyone that has to work with that hack.

author: Christopher Z
text:
I cannot honestly believe this movie was loved by so many. I'm not some contrarian, I absolutely love movies both serious cinema and B movies.
But Top Gun: Maverick was so incredibly stupid. It was literally the first movie redone the exact same way with an even more moronic plot than the original. You need to fly low in order to destroy some facility? That's utter nonsense. And then the behind enemy lines stealing of a jet? What is this an Owen Wilson movie? Seriously this movie was so bad I was laughing at how idiotic it was.

author: James N
text: The flight scenes are incredible, as expected. The movie, as a whole, is garbage. The casting, the story line, the sets..... just bad. It's like "Bring It On" meets "Fast and Furious". The original Top Gun was filmed on navy bases, in real bars, in real barracks, etc. This is a hodge podge of bad sets, CGI back grounds, and ridiculous hollywood movie tricks. Bummer.

author: Jared C
text: Predictable hero's journey drivel. So many cliche's it was hard to keep track of. The admittedly entertaining and dramatic flight scenes are ruined by the fact that the climactic mission through a trench at high speed to hit an impossibly small target is practically a frame by frame rip off of Star Wars Episode iV. There may never have been a film less deserving of the praise it has received.

author: STEPHEN P
text: Of course way over hyped and way over done. Relying on so much "action" and special effects just is a substitute for better writing and character development - this whole thing is Alpha male, never loses, no matter what even crazy odds against it. Surprise - very predictable.

author: Eiren W
text:
A film that shows happens when you chuck money at a film, without talent or reason. Fine if you‚Äôre bored mid week, but does not earn the rating it has at all. So many more captivating and brilliant films out there that have scores less than this. 
Basically Tom Cruise staring off into the distance and tensing his jawline on loop

author: prawnda s
text: i cannot deny that this is a technically impressive film. at the same time, i dont know how they managed to make fighter jet combat so boring.

author: Jimmy R
text:
It has a 99% score cause of all the fan boys and girls :D Its an okay action movie if you dont expect anything. Its so, SO! predictable. If you think it cant check all the clishees - trust me it will. F.e.: Very first scene: "you go 10 Mach, not 10.2, not 10.1" and of course he will go over the mark.
And very american patriotic. Doesn¬¥t matter who dies as long as its no person from the US :D
It passes the time but not a 99% movie at all.

author: Iain D
text:
Genuinely awful compared to the original. I don't know why people liked it so much. It was the disappointment of a lifetime. 
The original had a great storyline, it was believable, the characters were believable, the action scenes weren't overly falsified apart from the inverted scene with a MiG/F-5.
Nothing about this film is believable. CGI-tastic. Apparently the creme de la creme of the US Navy aviators are just out of nappies. Maverick flies a Mach 9-doesn't exist-looks ridiculous-nicked it without authorisation plane and ejects landing in a pub.... WTAF?!
The storyline is woeful and the acting is dreadful. 
As a huge fan of the original this is honestly one of the worst films I've ever seen. Sorry.

author: T Scott B
text: What a piece of crap. Nothing believable in this movie, complete horseshit.

author: Miles  O
text: I mean it was alright, I found it quite cheesy with most characters having little depth or actual personality about them. I feel like it was mostly about ticking boxes rather than trying to make a good movie.

author: Paul M
text:
I don't get the love for this one. Silly and cringe-worthy story (even after a 2nd viewing). Too sentimental, made worse by Zimmer's soulless score that keeps droning on. The story arc is a heck of a lot flatter than the bombing mission being flown, lackluster acting, obvious vfx scenes that don't match the real plane action, etc etc.

An unworthy successor to the great 80s Top Gun.

author: Gregory T
text: Absolutely terrible movie. I walked out after 10 minutes. Last time I did that was with Mama Mia.

author: R D
text: What a roller coaster of a ride!! And just like a roller coaster its good for about 2 minutes, then your off to find something else to do.  How this made the top 10 of the top 300 of all time is way beyond belief.  Im guessing dollars push it there.  Money not well spent.

author: Sam P
text:
A total snooze fest. Annoying, unlikeable characters retread the tedious footsteps of the annoying, unlikeable but at least vaguely iconic characters of the first movie. Visually dull, politically revolting and structured like a bowl of milkless porridge.

The high scores are because people saw a man on the screen whooping with delight, and like the apes they are they felt compelled to do the same.

author: Suicide N
text: I have never checked a movie 6 times to see how much longer the torture world continue.  Not memorable at all and quite boring.

author: Ralph W
text: Awful. Wafer thin plot completely unbelievable. A couple of hours of my life I'll never get back.

text: Assisti com nojinho e desprezo, toda admira√ß√£o pela beleza e talento de Tom Cruise d√£o lugar a perplexidade a cada dia de um novo 'esc√¢ndalo', desculpe me, mas n√£o consigo separar o pessoal do profissional quando se trata de abandono parental, menos encantada ao descobrir o que uma religi√£o (Cientologia?!?!) pode ser t√£o destrutiva ao ponto de separa um pai de sua filha, e os filhos de uma m√£e, triste‚Ä¶ Filme chatinho, conforme minha enorme m√° vontade para com ele..

text: Not enough world building in my opinion

text: I worked with these A/C on the flightline back in the day. This movie portrays NOTHING in reality.

author: Crom M
text:
Did ai write this movie? 
I loved the original, but this movie is awful.

author: unknown
text: This movie was terrible üëé it was clich√©, predictable and LAME. Do not watch this movie if you wanna be bored out of your everloving mindüôÑ

author: Jon R
text: Parachuting out of jet going Mach 100 and then knocking on someone‚Äôs door?  This movie is the worst. If I could have given less than a half star I would have.

author: R Z
text: It insists upon itself.

author: David B
text: Did not like the first top gun,and top gun 2 is just as bad very over the top American bullshit,bar scenes embarrassing to watch,tom cruise is good,but sorry it was same story as before,glad I did not pay to see this

text: basically advertising for military

text: Just watched some of thus on TV, Nd turned over after an hour...... it's so boring and clich√© ridden.

author: unknown
text: It's one of the corniest movies ever made. Honestly a waste of time.

author: John R
text: This was the most ridiculous and over rated movie of all time. The entire plot line is pathetic and Miles Teller finished off the movie with his terrible acting.

author: Matthew K
text: Is this a remake? Or a "new" movie? Come on, here.

author: laughoy4
text: Horrible story telling, completely fake action, horrendous development. How people found this good was terrifying about movie consumers. Nothing was explained and everything was full of plot holes. Terrible film

author: mike f
text: Yet another example of self glorifying American Exceptionalism.  When another country (besides US) aquires WMDs our military decides to unilaterally defy international law.  For the only country that has used nukes to act so morally superior is the height of hypocrisy, and this silly little flick perpetuates the lies.

author: Christopher H
text: Stupid, one-dimensional drivel, chok full of clich√©s. TV movie quality acting, at best.

author: Qumars R
text: Penny got a car, devastated

text: Silly and predictable - hero survives, is lauded and gets the girl. Supporting cast is  weak and action takes are not credible. Escapists - enjoy! :)

author: K
text: Total BS plot.  Fake flying   Fake bar, fake military uniforms. Just over it's junk. No way our military would act like there's only one option and make it all depend on one person. Plus Cruise treats our military like garbage and that they should cater to him.

author: c c
text:
This was clearly made by diversity hires.  The writing and story are awful.  They make some bs mission with bs details.  is this really worth what they're doing?  don't even get me started on the romance part of the movie.  I had to skip before i died of cringe. 

I'm not saying the first one was good but it clearly had some brain cells behind it, where this one was, lacking.
